Sibyl
programme.desc: Sibyl: Directed by Justine Triet. With Virginie Efira, Adèle Exarchopoulos, Gaspard Ulliel, Sandra Hüller. A jaded psychotherapist returns to her first passion of becoming a writer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9173264/","name":"Sibyl","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDY3MmQ3NzMtYTUxMi00ZWQzLThjNmYtNmE5MjUyYTU1MGRmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A jaded psychotherapist returns to her first passion of becoming a writer.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9173264/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"random-70778"},"dateCreated":"2019-12-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"so many good elements -- put together as nonsense","reviewBody":"I can't recall seeing a film with so many good and great elements: cinematography, acting, a good deal of great dialogue, that was assembled into such a let down of total experience. programme.title: Utrata
programme.desc: Każdy z członków rodziny na swój sposób próbuje sobie poradzić ze stratą. Nastoletni Piotrek stara się, żeby jego młodszy brat nie odczuwał pustki. Osamotniony, stopniowo traci siłę, aby mierzyć się z codziennością.

programme.title: Rykoszety
programme.desc: Polska, 1982 rok. Nastroje społeczne stają się coraz bardziej napięte. Dwóch braci, będących górnikami, ma odmienne zdanie dotyczące postawy, jaką należy przyjąć w obliczu komunistycznego systemu. Janek (Stanisław Linowski) angażuje się w działania podziemia na rzecz demokracji. Tadek (Tomasz Schuchardt) natomiast woli zachować neutralność. Między mężczyznami pogłębia się konflikt.

On Chesil Beach
programme.desc: On Chesil Beach: Directed by Dominic Cooke. With Billy Howle, Saoirse Ronan, Andy Burse, Rasmus Hardiker. In 1962 England, a young couple find their idyllic romance colliding with issues of sexual freedom and societal pressure, leading to an awkward and fateful wedding night." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1667321/","name":"On Chesil Beach","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzQ1MjI5OTg1M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzIyODc4NDM@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 1962 England, a young couple find their idyllic romance colliding with issues of sexual freedom and societal pressure, leading to an awkward and fateful wedding night.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1667321/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"spencer-39789"},"dateCreated":"2018-06-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Love Saoirse, but ...","reviewBody":"This movie was a particular disappointment as Saoirse put in another wonderful performance and the co-star Billy Howle was also good. It is a coming-of-age movie with the awkwardness of the two parties being central. But unfortunately the scenes of their awkwardness go on forever and the quite nice music in the background, rather than making it more important, just seems to be pushing it. This movie needed a lot more substance or a lot sharper editing ... or maybe a different director. Maybe the moral is that the author (here Ian McEwan, whose work I like a lot) shouldn't be allowed to write the screenplay. Not an unpleasant way to spend a couple of hours, but I really hope that Saoirse takes on meatier roles.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":10834,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Music","Romance"],"datePublished":"2018-05-18","keywords":"honeymoon,fear of intimacy,year 1962,wedding night,chamber music","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1060223001","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGNlYjZiNjEtYzFjNS00ZWNlLWFhOTYtOGM1ZDZkZGE3MzRmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg2NjQwMDQ@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGNlYjZiNjEtYzFjNS00ZWNlLWFhOTYtOGM1ZDZkZGE3MzRmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg2NjQwMDQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"In England, 1962, a young couple finds their idyllic romance colliding with issues of sexual freedom and societal pressure, leading to an awkward and fateful wedding night."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6247071/","name":"Billy Howle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1519680/","name":"Saoirse Ronan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9241204/","name":"Andy Burse"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4315078/","name":"Dominic Cooke"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0116615/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0784444/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0568605/","name":"Ian McEwan"}],"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Undir trénu
W cieniu drzewa
Undir trénu
programme.desc:
Undir trénu: Directed by Hafsteinn Gunnar Sigurðsson. With Steinþór Hróar Steinþórsson, Edda Björgvinsdóttir, Sigurður Sigurjónsson, Þorsteinn Bachmann. When Baldwin and Inga's next door neighbours complain that a tree in their backyard casts a shadow over their sundeck, what starts off as a typical spat between neighbours in the suburbs unexpectedly and violently spirals out of control." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6223806/","name":"Undir trénu","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmJlYjY0NjItYzJmOC00Y2RhLTgyNGQtN2MzM2VjMWJlYWQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODAzODU1NDQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"When Baldwin and Inga's next door neighbours complain that a tree in their backyard casts a shadow over their sundeck, what starts off as a typical spat between neighbours in the suburbs unexpectedly and violently spirals out of cont","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6223806/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TheLittleSongbird"},"dateCreated":"2018-08-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Feuding neighbours","reviewBody":"Have a lot of love for foreign language films, of all decades and all genres. That and that it was another film seen as part of my quest to see as many 2018 films as possible were my main reasons in seeing 'Under the Tree' from Icelandic director Hafsteinn Gunnar Sigurdsson. 

'Under the Tree' is a truly fine film and manages to take a relevant subject (feuding neighbours) and explore it in a way that was hilarious, shocking and moving. It won't be one of my favourite films any time soon, but in no way should it be overlooked and should be seen as an example of how to execute a film with a subject like this well. Sadly, 'Under the Tree' has been released here alongside more expensive in budget films that have been quite big box office successes and films that people are more likely to go and see. While having enjoyed many of the films in question (in no way is it intended to be knock), 'Under the Tree' is better than most of them and deserves better.

Sure 'Under the Tree' is occasionally a touch overcooked and some may find some of the behaviours extreme. 

However, Sigurdsson directs with a perfect balance of hilarious mayhem and melancholic pathos. This is also reflected in the thought-provoking script he scripted with Huldar Breidfjord. Many parts are hilarious in a dark way, others genuinely shock and there are emotional parts too, all in a way that is kept plausible throughout. Neighbour feuding sounds insignificant on paper to some, but 'Under the Tree' makes it darkly funny, disturbing and melancholic, a not easy feat but beautifully done here.

The storytelling is always compelling, with the tensions having a bleakness and ferocity while still entertaining and emotionally resonating. There is a good deal happening, but not in a way that it feels cluttered with too many characters and subplots, instead there is enough breathing space and depth while having an alertness to the drama. 

A good cast would be needed to bring all this life. Luckily, 'Under the Tree's' cast is excellent. Particularly note-worthy of a cast where everybody is good and nobody bad is Edda Bjorgvinsdottir on fiercely intense form, her character near-unhinged. 

It is a very well made film visually, beautifully shot in particular. The music is inspired, appropriate and cleverly used.

IMDb data; ttnr: 6223806, Title: Undir trénu, --- Description: Undir trénu: Directed by Hafsteinn Gunnar Sigurðsson. With Steinþór Hróar Steinþórsson, Edda Björgvinsdóttir, Sigurður Sigurjónsson, Þorsteinn Bachmann. When Baldwin and Inga's next door neighbours complain that a tree in their backyard casts a shadow over their sundeck, what starts off as a typical spat between neighbours in the suburbs unexpectedly and violently spirals out of control." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6223806/","name":"Undir trénu","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmJlYjY0NjItYzJmOC00Y2RhLTgyNGQtN2MzM2VjMWJlYWQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODAzODU1NDQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"When Baldwin and Inga's next door neighbours complain that a tree in their backyard casts a shadow over their sundeck, what starts off as a typical spat between neighbours in the suburbs unexpectedly and violently spirals out of cont","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6223806/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"TheLittleSongbird","dateCreated":"2018-08-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Feuding neighbours","reviewBody":"Have a lot of love for foreign language films, of all decades and all genres. That and that it was another film seen as part of my quest to see as many 2018 films as possible were my main reasons in seeing 'Under the Tree' from Icelandic director Hafsteinn Gunnar Sigurdsson. 

'Under the Tree' is a truly fine film and manages to take a relevant subject (feuding neighbours) and explore it in a way that was hilarious, shocking and moving. It won't be one of my favourite films any time soon, but in no way should it be overlooked and should be seen as an example of how to execute a film with a subject like this well. Sadly, 'Under the Tree' has been released here alongside more expensive in budget films that have been quite big box office successes and films that people are more likely to go and see. While having enjoyed many of the films in question (in no way is it intended to be knock), 'Under the Tree' is better than most of them and deserves better.

Sure 'Under the Tree' is occasionally a touch overcooked and some may find some of the behaviours extreme. 

However, Sigurdsson directs with a perfect balance of hilarious mayhem and melancholic pathos. This is also reflected in the thought-provoking script he scripted with Huldar Breidfjord. Many parts are hilarious in a dark way, others genuinely shock and there are emotional parts too, all in a way that is kept plausible throughout. Neighbour feuding sounds insignificant on paper to some, but 'Under the Tree' makes it darkly funny, disturbing and melancholic, a not easy feat but beautifully done here.

The storytelling is always compelling, with the tensions having a bleakness and ferocity while still entertaining and emotionally resonating. There is a good deal happening, but not in a way that it feels cluttered with too many characters and subplots, instead there is enough breathing space and depth while having an alertness to the drama. 

A good cast would be needed to bring all this life. Luckily, 'Under the Tree's' cast is excellent. Particularly note-worthy of a cast where everybody is good and nobody bad is Edda Bjorgvinsdottir on fiercely intense form, her character near-unhinged. 

It is a very well made film visually, beautifully shot in particular. The music is inspired, appropriate and cleverly used.

Overall, great and shouldn't be forgotten. 9/10 Bethany Cox","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4499,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2017-09-06","keywords":"tree,revenge,sex scene,husband wife relationship,next door neighbor","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1409204505","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTcwODVjOWYtZjcyNi00MzkzLWI5MjYtNTVmMjlmYzMxMzY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTcwODVjOWYtZjcyNi00MzkzLWI5MjYtNTVmMjlmYzMxMzY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2621096/","name":"Steinþór Hróar Steinþórsson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0084908/","name":"Edda Björgvinsdóttir","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0797610/","name":"Sigurður Sigurjónsson"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2619779/","name":"Hafsteinn Gunnar Sigurðsson"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0453485/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0464992/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048411/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1458057/","name":"Huldar Breiðfjörð","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2619779/","name":"Hafsteinn Gunnar Sigurðsson"],"duration":"PT1H29M"</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: The Vanishing: Directed by George Sluizer. With Jeff Bridges, Kiefer Sutherland, Nancy Travis, Sandra Bullock. The boyfriend of an abducted woman never gives up the search as the abductor looks on." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0108473/","name":"The Vanishing","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmUwMmU2YzgtYTU3OC00YzlmLWJlYTgtM2NmMzYzNGU2ODZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The boyfriend of an abducted woman never gives up the search as the abductor looks on.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0108473/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"SuperMovieFanatic"},"dateCreated":"1999-08-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Hmmm...2 versions. Which should I watch?","reviewBody":"As everyone who has reviewed this film here has mentioned, there are two versions of this movie, one Dutch, one American, both directed by the same fellow. Which should you see first? Which should you avoid, if any? Decide for yourself... I saw the Dutch version in 1994, and it absolutely blew my socks off. I was horrified, didn't want to keep watching it, but I was pulled in and couldn't stop until the brilliant, ultra-chilling, uncompromising finale. This was my first foreign film, and so I was completely unprepared for such a non-Hollywood experience. I will remember this movie for the rest of my life. Later on, I caught the American version in the theatres, watched it, a few thrills here and there, yadda, yadda. Jeff Bridges was pretty creepy, but quite frankly, I would have completely forgotten about it by now if it weren't for the original. It's not horrible, it just pales in comparison to a masterpiece."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":24701,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"1993-02-05","keywords":"kidnapping,obsession,missing person,buried alive,remake by original director","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Vanishing","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi805044505","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWQzZTExZTctOGY5OS00NWRiLWFjZTItMGE5ODU1ZjNjNDlhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWQzZTExZTctOGY5OS00NWRiLWFjZTItMGE5ODU1ZjNjNDlhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000313/","name":"Jeff Bridges"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000662/","name":"Kiefer Sutherland"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001802/","name":"Nancy Travis"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0806293/","name":"George Sluizer"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0469104/","name":"Tim Krabbé"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0333804/","name":"Todd Graff"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

On an isolated island in Brittany at the end of the eighteenth century, a female painter is obliged to paint a wedding portrait of a young woman." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8613070/","name":"Portrait de la jeune fille en feu","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjgwNjkwOWYtYmM3My00NzI1LTk5OGItYWY0OTMyZTY4OTg2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODk4OTc3MTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"On an isolated island in Brittany at the end of the eighteenth century, a female painter is obliged to paint a wedding portrait of a young woman.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8613070/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jcc_murray"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Achingly beautiful","reviewBody":"I cannot recall the last time I watched a film that had me utterly mesmerised from the very start to the very end without a single interruption. Everything about this film is so lovingly crafted, from the nuanced and commanding central performances to the cinematography and subtly woven storyline - they all combine to produce a genuine piece of cinematic art. The lighting and palette drew inspiration from 18th century paintings, there are scenes in this film that will stay with me fore some time... and the slowly building inevitable climax to the story is heart achingly gratifying. An utterly original and beautiful instant classic that somehow didn't capture the attention of the Oscars Academy!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":80982,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2019-09-18","keywords":"lesbian relationship,portrait painting,arranged marriage,painting,portrait","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi94879513","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzlhZDg4YjUtMGMxMS00YzgzLWE4ZWMtNmUwYjc5NzlmYTA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzlhZDg4YjUtMGMxMS00YzgzLWE4ZWMtNmUwYjc5NzlmYTA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Directed by Céline Sciamma. programme.title: Mój kraj taki piękny
programme.desc: W Polsce trwa spór pomiędzy dwoma ugrupowaniami - narodowcami i ich przeciwnikami. Grzegorz Paprzycki dokumentuje przebieg tych potyczek. Pojawia się w samym środku wydarzeń, podczas których niejednokrotnie dochodzi do aktów przemocy. Film stanowi subiektywne spojrzenie na konflikt, który toczy się na polskich ulicach. Za swój obraz reżyser otrzymał Złotego Lajkonika na Krakowskim Festiwalu Filmowym.

credits.actor: Jakub Kopeć
Aleksander Krzystyniak
Grzegorz Paprzycki
Rafał Paluszkiewicz
Justyna Koziarz

programme.title: Tamtej nocy
programme.desc: Zuzanna Szwarc (Hanna Konarowska), mama kilkuletniej dziewczynki, pracuje jako kuratorka sztuki. Pewnego wieczoru widzi napad. Dwóch mężczyzna atakuje chłopaka. Zuza nie pozostaje obojętna i stara się go obronić. Kiedy na miejsce przybywa policja, to jednak ona, nie sprawcy pobicia, zostaje aresztowana.

programme.title: Dzień jak co dzień
programme.desc: Ania z córką Basią jadą na casting do telewizyjnego talent show. Z dziewczynką zaczyna dziać się coś dziwnego, ale matka tego nie zauważa. Podczas występu Basia wybiega ze sceny. Ania musi zmierzyć się ze swoimi kompleksami, by dostrzec i zrozumieć potrzeby córki.

programme.title: Nowi mieszkańcy
Nachmieter
programme.desc: Rok 1945. Niemcy opuszczają Wrocław. Jedna z mieszkających pod miastem rodzin zmuszona jest zostać kilka miesięcy dłużej, niż zakładała. W jej domu zjawia się już jednak polska grupa krewnych. Obydwa klany mają poczucie krzywdy i wzajemnie są do siebie uprzedzone.

programme.title: Transfer kosmicznej energii
programme.desc: Radek jest ambitnym coachem motywacyjnym. Robi karierę w korporacji. Mężczyzna traci pewność siebie w momencie, gdy uczestniczy w bójce w knajpie. Decyduje się na nielegalne techniki hakowania mózgu. Niestety rezultaty są inne, niż się spodziewał.

programme.title: I Am Burt Reynolds
Burt Reynolds: Bandzior, piosenkarz, aktor
I Am Burt Reynolds
programme.desc: I Am Burt Reynolds: Directed by Adrian Buitenhuis. With Adam Rifkin, Alfie Wise, Ann Scurry, Ariel Winter. Burt Reynolds was the epitome of American macho. Known for his charm, his iconic mustache and penchant for women and cars. His career includes more than 200 films and TV series, a nude photo on a bearskin in Cosmopolitan, but also a fight against drug addiction due to stunt injuries. Through rarely viewed archive material and interviews with his family, friends and colleagues, an intimate portrait of one of America's most beloved stars is drawn." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt13721940/","name":"I Am Burt Reynolds","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTIyMzVmMDctNjJlMy00NjNmLWE1M2ItYjI2NDcwZmUxZTBkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyODk3NTgz._V1_.jpg","description":"Burt Reynolds was the epitome of American macho. Known for his charm, his iconic mustache and penchant for women and cars. His career includes more than 200 films and TV series, a nude photo on a bearskin in Cosmopolitan, but also a ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt13721940/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dakjets"},"dateCreated":"2021-08-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"A great moviestar","reviewBody":"This documentary about Burt Reynholds is interesting, informative and entertaining. The documentary is largely based on Reynhold's career, but also deals with his private life. The film's strength is good analyzes of his achievements on the screen made by close friends and colleagues in the industry. Jon Voight and Bruce Dern's participation in the film in particular gives the documentary weight as they were both close friends and colleagues of Burt. programme.title: Gdy nie będzie już bestii
Qu'importe si les bêtes meurent
programme.desc: Abdellah (Fouad Oughaou) jest młodym pasterzem mieszkającym w górach. Chłopak musi się przedrzeć przez potężne zwały śniegu, aby zdobyć pożywienie i uratować swoje bydło. W końcu udaje mu się dotrzeć do wioski. Napotyka tam nadprzyrodzone zjawisko.

programme.title: Hi, How Are You
programme.desc: Bezrobotny pięćdziesięcioletni Sławek (Jacek Poniedziałek) ma problem z zabiciem wolnego czasu. Mężczyzna przesiaduje w domu bądź włóczy się po osiedlu, szukając zaginionego kota. W najlepszym razie wykonuje różnego rodzaju prace zlecone mu przez żonę. Pewnego dnia Sławek poznaje tajemniczą sąsiadkę Kamilę (Maja Szopa). Kobieta zaprasza go do swojego ogrodu.

She learns that he has dark secrets.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8569390/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mjfhhh"},"dateCreated":"2020-03-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"a meaningful look at a family in crisis","reviewBody":"When her grandson suddenly appears on her doorstep Muriel rejoices. She is a successful horse breeder and her life is beautiful in a simple way, her corner of the world as stunning as it is remote. But with the arrival of her grandson a dark suspicion creeps in. Will Muriel be able to take a stand against the imminent danger to her grandson? And what does it mean to truly save someone?

The grim reality of radicalised youngsters in France is showcased in an unlikely surrounding. The French countryside seems to be the furthest place from the raging Syrian war, but the evil spreads its tentacles everywhere. The radicalised Muslims are shown in unflinchingly brutal way although it's never a secret that the kids who found themselves in this situation are out of their depth. Without prejudice the movie delivers both sides of the argument, showcasing how exactly one can become brainwashed in a modern unreliable world with no real values.

Catherine Deneuve is marvellous in the film, looking stunning at the age of 77. She looks naturally beautiful in the French village setting. Deneuve delivers the small but heartbreaking drama of Muriel with the reliable focus of an acting veteran, tinged with love and hope.

FAREWELL TO THE NIGHT may not give full justice to the complex subjects It touches upon, but it is a meaningful look at a family in crisis that mimics the crisis of the modern world.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":622,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-04-24","keywords":"year 2015,south of france,grandmother grandson relationship,orphan,horse riding","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [English SUB]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi429964825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTFhZmNjYzYtZTM0Ny00NTkxLWE5ZjEtZWY2NmJlZjIwZWU1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTFhZmNjYzYtZTM0Ny00NTkxLWE5ZjEtZWY2NmJlZjIwZWU1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000366/","name":"Catherine Deneuve"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3197772/","name":"Kacey Mottet Klein"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4205963/","name":"Oulaya Amamra"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0029242/","name":"André Téchiné"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0571461/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0063732/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0729612/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1462233/","name":"Amer Alwan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5674565/","name":"Léa Mysius"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0029242/","name":"André Téchiné"}],"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

A dynamic and full of punk energy story based on life of one of the most original and interesting contemporary artist, the performer, Oskar Dawicki (playing himself). The main theme of his art is the search for an answer to the question of whether. Oskar Dawicki exists at all. programme.title: The Craft
Szkoła czarownic
The Craft
programme.desc:
The Craft: Directed by Andrew Fleming. With Robin Tunney, Fairuza Balk, Neve Campbell, Rachel True. A newcomer to a Catholic prep high school falls in with a trio of outcast teenage girls who practice witchcraft, and they all soon conjure up various spells and curses against those who anger them." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0115963/","name":"The Craft","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTBkMWE1NGItZTgxMi00ZTE0LWIzZjAtNzQ5ZGZlZTQxN2EwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A newcomer to a Catholic prep high school falls in with a trio of outcast teenage girls who practice witchcraft, and they all soon conjure up various spells and curses against those who anger them.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0115963/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"RobertF87"},"dateCreated":"2005-01-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Interesting and Entertaining Film","reviewBody":"This is a very entertaining blend of supernatural thriller and teen movie. Sarah (played by Robin Tunney) is the new girl at a Catholic shool in Los Angeles where she meets a group of girls (Fairuza Balk, Neve Campbell and Rachel True) who dabble in witchcraft. When Sarah joins the group they discover that they have genuine power and start using it to sort out their personal problems, until the group's leader Nacy (Balk) starts taking it too far.

The film is well-made and several shades darker than the average teen movie. The cast are all very good, especially Fairuza Balk who easily steals the film with her part.

The film's portrayal of witchcraft is a bit more interesting than the standard Hollywood portrayal, and it certainly doesn't represent it as essentially "evil", which makes a nice change. However, as always, this is Hollywood so many liberties will have been taken with genuine wiccan practices.

The film is worth a look, however. IMDb data; ttnr: 0115963, Title: The Craft, --- Description: The Craft: Directed by Andrew Fleming. With Robin Tunney, Fairuza Balk, Neve Campbell, Rachel True. A newcomer to a Catholic prep high school falls in with a trio of outcast teenage girls who practice witchcraft, and they all soon conjure up various spells and curses against those who anger them." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0115963/","name":"The Craft","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTBkMWE1NGItZTgxMi00ZTE0LWIzZjAtNzQ5ZGZlZTQxN2EwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A newcomer to a Catholic prep high school falls in with a trio of outcast teenage girls who practice witchcraft, and they all soon conjure up various spells and curses against those who anger them.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0115963/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"RobertF87","dateCreated":"2005-01-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Interesting and Entertaining Film","reviewBody":"This is a very entertaining blend of supernatural thriller and teen movie. Sarah (played by Robin Tunney) is the new girl at a Catholic shool in Los Angeles where she meets a group of girls (Fairuza Balk, Neve Campbell and Rachel True) who dabble in witchcraft. When Sarah joins the group they discover that they have genuine power and start using it to sort out their personal problems, until the group's leader Nacy (Balk) starts taking it too far.

The film is well-made and several shades darker than the average teen movie. The cast are all very good, especially Fairuza Balk who easily steals the film with her part.

The film's portrayal of witchcraft is a bit more interesting than the standard Hollywood portrayal, and it certainly doesn't represent it as essentially "evil", which makes a nice change. However, as always, this is Hollywood so many liberties will have been taken with genuine wiccan practices.

The film is worth a look, however. The only thing that lets it down is the overblown climax.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":88129,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Horror"],"datePublished":"1996-05-03","keywords":"witch,witchcraft,teenage witch,bully comeuppance,friendship","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Craft","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi76463897","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU1ZmJhMzEtMGIwZi00NWEyLTk0ZmYtNWQyYTk2NDEwOWMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU1ZmJhMzEtMGIwZi00NWEyLTk0ZmYtNWQyYTk2NDEwOWMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000677/","name":"Robin Tunney","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000103/","name":"Fairuza Balk","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000117/","name":"Neve Campbell"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0281598/","name":"Andrew Fleming"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093794/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0276823/","name":"Peter Filardi","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0281598/","name":"Andrew Fleming"],"duration":"PT1H41M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Mama
programme.desc: Lilly i Victoria znikają w tajemniczych okolicznościach tuż po tym, jak ich matka zostaje zamordowana. Wujek sióstr Lucas (Nikolaj Coster-Waldau) wraz z narzeczoną Annabel (Jessica Chastain) rozpoczyna poszukiwania. Dziewczynki udaje się odnaleźć dopiero po pięciu latach. Lucas i Annabel zabierają je do siebie. Odtąd w ich domu zaczynają dziać się niepokojące rzeczy.

programme.title: Diabolique
Diabolique
programme.desc:
Diabolique: Directed by Jeremiah S. Chechik. With Sharon Stone, Isabelle Adjani, Chazz Palminteri, Kathy Bates. The wife and mistress of the sadistic dean of an exclusive prep school conspire to murder him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0116095/","name":"Diabolique","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmFmOWRkZWEtYWZlNC00MDQyLWFlODAtODdjNzU5MzY5ZGE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The wife and mistress of the sadistic dean of an exclusive prep school conspire to murder him.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0116095/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"aimless-46"},"dateCreated":"2005-06-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Blame The Director-Not the Cast","reviewBody":"With some of Hollywood's worst trash on his resume, Director Jeremiah Chechik gives us something slightly better than his worst ("The Avengers") and much worse than his best ("Benny and Joon").

This oddly unsatisfying 1996 remake of the classic 1955 French thriller illustrates Hollywood's ham handed ability to turn a classic suspense tale into a weak atmosphere piece. I say oddly because Isabelle Adjani and Sharon Stone are together on the screen for almost the entire film and the two actresses truly bring out the best in each other. So you have a long series of well-played scenes by fine actresses, but they are strung together into a slow paced story line that lacks unity and consistent motivation. Which could be caused by a lot of things but is most likely the result of trimming in post-production, in which important unifying elements were left on the cutting room floor. Or it could be that the director and production designer just failed to translate the writer's vision onto the screen.

Since this ultimately this is a story about an evil character who develops a sentimental side, it is absolutely critical that this process is communicated to the audience. The audience should not just be surprised by the ending but should be able to think back and see all the motivational pieces click into place. In this regard the movie is a complete failure.

Then there is the issue of cheating. Because we only know what he wants to tell us, a director has a variety of legit ways to introduce misdirection and surprise into a film. But occasionally a director lacks the integrity and vision to play by the rules. Such is the case here as only the audience sees the underwater shot of a clearly drowned Guy (Chazz Palminteri). It is shown to convince us that he is dead but this then makes his reanimation impossible. Plus it is fairly useless because you know that he has to come back for there to be much of a story. That is cheating and there is more cheating in the unintentionally comical climatic scene. The beauty of the original movie was the absence of cheating and the macabre irony of the ending. All that is missing.

Whatever, it means that the only reason to watch this version of "Diabolique" is for the acting of Adjani and Stone. Although Adjani was 40-41 years old when she made this film, she has lost little of her beauty. While she was probably the world's most beautiful actress in her twenties, there is simply no debate that she was the most beautiful 40 year-old in cinema history. Stone pretty much plays her hard-as-nails self but she is given some great lines and her character is a great contrast to the ethereal take Adjani gives to her own character.

If you are looking for a better but less obvious remake of the original "Diabolique", track down 1971's "Let's Scare Jessica To Death". This almost forgotten horror classic is truly scary. It has much better production design than 1996's "Diabolique", with creepy whispering and images that stay with you and creep you out even weeks later. Jessica is a woman recently released from a mental "institution" who goes to a farm in a quiet rural area. The odd locals and their local legends begin to mess with Jessica's head as her husband and his secret girlfriend attempt to scare her to death.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14109,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"1996-10-28","keywords":"stockings,woman on top,dead body in a bathtub,dead body in a car,death in a bathtub","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Diabolique","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi950141209","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTQ5ZWE4MTAtZjFlNi00MjZhLWFhNGUtMzcwZDlmZjIwODY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTQ5ZWE4MTAtZjFlNi00MjZhLWFhNGUtMzcwZDlmZjIwODY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Warner Home Video"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000232/","name":"Sharon Stone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000254/","name":"Isabelle Adjani"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001590/","name":"Chazz Palminteri"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0154819/","name":"Jeremiah S. Chechik"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033326/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0027919/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0092267/","name":"Pierre Boileau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0092268/","name":"Thomas Narcejac"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0167241/","name":"Henri-Georges Clouzot"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Cop Car
Radiowóz
Cop Car
programme.desc:
Cop Car: Directed by Jon Watts. With Kevin Bacon, James Freedson-Jackson, Hays Wellford, Camryn Manheim. programme.title: Binhi
Binhi
programme.desc: Binhi: Directed by Pedring Lopez. With Roxanne Barcelo, Cholo Barretto, Joem Bascon, Akihiro Blanco. Daniel and Cynthia, a young couple with a child on the way, experience some hard times in Manila. They head back to Baguio, where Daniel is originally from, to start over again. Through the kindness of Alex, Daniel's well-to-do childhood friend, they get to stay in a large house, rent-free; and he gets a job offer as well. The worst seems to be over for them. Or so they think. Funny things start to happen in their nice house. It starts out as movements caught on the periphery, whispered sounds, unexplained feelings. It's seems that the house in haunted. The ghost is a child. A little girl. The spirit manifests in the house and follows the occupants around. Daniel, whose past is a mystery to his wife, has been running away from something or someone in Baguio. He's starting to realize that what he has been running away from is starting to haunt him. As the story progresses, the subtle manifestations become full-blown apparitions. The film culminates in a series of flashbacks experience by Daniel - celebrating his recent graduation, partying and getting drunk in the process, driving under the influence, causing a deadly car accident with a mother and child, the mother seemingly dying, the little girl with faint signs of life, Daniel taking her to the hospital, the child seemingly dying in his arms, the moral dilemma Daniel goes through, his "Faustus" moment, his decision to bury the child in a remote, shallow grave, the child being buried alive! It is revealed that the little girl who Daniel buried alive is the ghost haunting them and the house that they're staying in was her family's!" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4678058/","name":"Binhi","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzAwNmI3OTItMjEzNi00YTMyLThhOGMtYzg3ODM0ZDMxNDMyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTI5NjIyMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Daniel and Cynthia, a young couple with a child on the way, experience some hard times in Manila. They head back to Baguio, where Daniel is originally from, to start over again. programme.title: Polar Opposites
Bieguny śmierci
Polar Opposites
programme.desc:
Polar Opposites: Directed by Fred Olen Ray. With Charles Shaughnessy, Tracy Nelson, Ken Barnett, Beth Grant. David Terran wrote scientific theories predicting an inevitable shift in Earth's magnetic poles. Then an Iranian underground nuclear test sets off a global phenomenon that matches David's doomsday scenario." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1172069/","name":"Polar Opposites","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTExMDg0MTQwNjReQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU3MDkyNTI2ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"David Terran wrote scientific theories predicting an inevitable shift in Earth's magnetic poles. Then an Iranian underground nuclear test sets off a global phenomenon that matches David's doomsday scenario.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1172069/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"SciVortex"},"dateCreated":"2008-06-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Science-Fact Rocks the World","reviewBody":"If you're expecting a splashy, big-budget Hollywood disaster flick, you should stick to "The Day After Tomorrow" or "Deep Impact." "Polar Opposites" strength does NOT come from million dollar fx, or performances by academy-award-winning actors. The thing that makes this low-budget independent film so engaging is the story and the relationships that develop while the story world unravels on screen.

At its simplest, "Polar Opposites" spins a tale about a possible global disaster set in motion by a nuclear blast, and how a scientist is called upon to save the day. The scientific theories proposed by the story are chillingly accurate, and they are what hooked me initially. It's refreshing to see science-fact made understandable and yes, entertaining (the tangerine/battery visual was funny). But the film goes beyond simply laying out facts and ideas to tell the story. It puts together a group of characters that have real issues in dealing with the problem, and with each other. There is a father/son relationship (Charles Shaunessy and Clive Revill) that is touching and real, funny and even corny at times. Tracey Nelson and Kieren Hutchinson play doctors coping with the crisis, but they still have a playful side to their relationship. And the actor playing their patient, Al (Ismael Carlo), is both unsettling and tender.

In the end, the disaster unfolds like it might in any other disaster flick (although, as I mentioned, without the huge big budget fx). But the story and the characters were the ingredient that actually made the film quite enjoyable.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":543,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama"],"datePublished":"2008-06-06","keywords":"nuclear test,friendship,scientist,writer,earthquake","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Deadly Shift","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi887948825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzQ4NDlhODktN2NlMy00YTY3LWE3MjItY2ZmMjkyMWUyODUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzQ4NDlhODktN2NlMy00YTY3LWE3MjItY2ZmMjkyMWUyODUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Ground Zero: The Deady Shift aka Polar Opposites"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0789478/","name":"Charles Shaughnessy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0625796/","name":"Tracy Nelson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1757373/","name":"Ken Barnett"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0676248/","name":"Fred Olen Ray"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0167713/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0563701/","name":"Paolo Mazzucato"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1172069, Title: Polar Opposites, --- Description: Polar Opposites: Directed by Fred Olen Ray. With Charles Shaughnessy, Tracy Nelson, Ken Barnett, Beth Grant. David Terran wrote scientific theories predicting an inevitable shift in Earth's magnetic poles. Then an Iranian underground nuclear test sets off a global phenomenon that matches David's doomsday scenario." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1172069/","name":"Polar Opposites","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTExMDg0MTQwNjReQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU3MDkyNTI2ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"David Terran wrote scientific theories predicting an inevitable shift in Earth's magnetic poles. Then an Iranian underground nuclear test sets off a global phenomenon that matches David's doomsday scenario.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1172069/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"SciVortex","dateCreated":"2008-06-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Science-Fact Rocks the World","reviewBody":"If you're expecting a splashy, big-budget Hollywood disaster flick, you should stick to "The Day After Tomorrow" or "Deep Impact." "Polar Opposites" strength does NOT come from million dollar fx, or performances by academy-award-winning actors. The thing that makes this low-budget independent film so engaging is the story and the relationships that develop while the story world unravels on screen.

At its simplest, "Polar Opposites" spins a tale about a possible global disaster set in motion by a nuclear blast, and how a scientist is called upon to save the day. The scientific theories proposed by the story are chillingly accurate, and they are what hooked me initially. It's refreshing to see science-fact made understandable and yes, entertaining (the tangerine/battery visual was funny). But the film goes beyond simply laying out facts and ideas to tell the story. It puts together a group of characters that have real issues in dealing with the problem, and with each other. There is a father/son relationship (Charles Shaunessy and Clive Revill) that is touching and real, funny and even corny at times. Tracey Nelson and Kieren Hutchinson play doctors coping with the crisis, but they still have a playful side to their relationship. And the actor playing their patient, Al (Ismael Carlo), is both unsettling and tender.

In the end, the disaster unfolds like it might in any other disaster flick (although, as I mentioned, without the huge big budget fx). But the story and the characters were the ingredient that actually made the film quite enjoyable.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":543,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama"],"datePublished":"2008-06-06","keywords":"nuclear test,friendship,scientist,writer,earthquake","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Deadly Shift","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi887948825","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzQ4NDlhODktN2NlMy00YTY3LWE3MjItY2ZmMjkyMWUyODUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzQ4NDlhODktN2NlMy00YTY3LWE3MjItY2ZmMjkyMWUyODUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Ground Zero: The Deady Shift aka Polar Opposites","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0789478/","name":"Charles Shaughnessy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0625796/","name":"Tracy Nelson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1757373/","name":"Ken Barnett"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0676248/","name":"Fred Olen Ray"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0167713/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0563701/","name":"Paolo Mazzucato"],"duration":"PT1H25M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Descent
Zagłada
Descent
programme.desc: The Descent: Directed by Neil Marshall. With Shauna Macdonald, Natalie Mendoza, Alex Reid, Saskia Mulder. A caving expedition goes horribly wrong, as the explorers become trapped and ultimately pursued by a strange breed of predators." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0435625/","name":"The Descent","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA5NzQ1NTgwNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjUxMzUzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A caving expedition goes horribly wrong, as the explorers become trapped and ultimately pursued by a strange breed of predators.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0435625/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"barberoux"},"dateCreated":"2006-08-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good Scary Movie","reviewBody":"When I read that "The Descent" featured an all women cast I expected a T+A extravaganza with spelunkers in too tight T-shirts and panties cavorting beneath the earth. I was disappointed. What I saw was a scary movie. I am not by nature claustrophobic but a few scenes of the close quarters they were climbing through left me squirming in my seat. I can't continue the review without issuing a SPOILER alert since I will be discussing critical movie facts. The movie was very spookily lit with looming shadows and false colors and was expertly designed. The creatures living below ground were creepy and scary since often they were only glimpsed in the shadows. I hadn't expected the death count to be so high nor the movie to be so bloody. I flinched often during the movie due to the sudden appearance of the creatures or from the wounds suffered by the cast. The pace of the movie once they began the cave exploration was very fast and of course with this type of movie a deeper examination of the facts reveals some plot holes but events move too fast for reflection. I can't say I liked or agreed with some events in the end of the movie. I think Juno, maybe not the best person in the group, was unfairly judged and condemned. None the less the movie was very effective in scaring me and holding my attention. The fact that it had, primarily, an all women cast was hardly noticeable. This is not a chick flic. Worth seeing.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":214767,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Adventure","Horror","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2006-03-22","keywords":"cave,survival horror,fear,group of friends,monster","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Descent","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2810904857","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTNmMDg5MzMtZDJjNi00NDYzLWExZjEtNmE0ZDJlOGY3MWVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTNmMDg5MzMtZDJjNi00NDYzLWExZjEtNmE0ZDJlOGY3MWVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Lionsgate Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0531933/","name":"Shauna Macdonald"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0413238/","name":"Natalie Mendoza"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0717157/","name":"Alex Reid"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0551076/","name":"Neil Marshall"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0152921/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0109425/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0068747/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0551076/","name":"Neil Marshall"}],"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Crazy Six
Crazy Six
programme.desc: Crazy Six: Directed by Albert Pyun. With Rob Lowe, Mario Van Peebles, Ice-T, Burt Reynolds. In a crumbling Europe, powerful mafia families have emerged from the anarchy to vie for control of the lucrative arms trade." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0118897/","name":"Crazy Six","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWZjMzMyMWUtZDJkNS00ZDY4LWFkNTMtYTNhMzYyMjE3MWE1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTY5Nzc4MDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a crumbling Europe, powerful mafia families have emerged from the anarchy to vie for control of the lucrative arms trade.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0118897/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Islander-4"},"dateCreated":"1998-10-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Don't bother!!","reviewBody":"As a fan of independent films I expected a lot more out of this movie. The worst part of the movie was the music. For some reason they found it necessary between scenes to return to the same droll song over and over again. The action in this movie was nonexistent, as was the interaction between characters. Mario van Peebles was casted as a French bad guy. This was by far the worst French accent I have ever heard. Rob Lowe was a junkie and played that very well. The rest of the actors weren't noteworthy. All in all, this movie falls into Top 5 bad movies of all time. I've seen B movies (Caged Heat, USA Up All Night, etc.) that had a better plot and acting."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1623,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":2.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime"],"keywords":"shootout,dog,gangster,american abroad,drug addict","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Crazy Six","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1447274009","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzlmNGIyY2YtNTg5OS00ZTU4LWJhMzgtNTNhMTliY2RjZGRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzlmNGIyY2YtNTg5OS00ZTU4LWJhMzgtNTNhMTliY2RjZGRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sterling Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000507/","name":"Rob Lowe"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000608/","name":"Burt Reynolds"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005522/","name":"Mario Van Peebles"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0089502/","name":"Albert Pyun"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009633/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0013199/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0950724/","name":"Galen Yuen"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Proud Mary
Proud Mary
programme.desc:
Proud Mary: Directed by Babak Najafi. With Taraji P. Henson, Billy Brown, Jahi Di'Allo Winston, Neal McDonough. Mary is a hit woman working for an organized crime family in Boston, whose life is completely turned around when she meets a young boy whose path she crosses when a professional hit goes bad." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6421110/","name":"Proud Mary","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA1MjI3MDU1MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjYwMTkxNDM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Mary is a hit woman working for an organized crime family in Boston, whose life is completely turned around when she meets a young boy whose path she crosses when a professional hit goes bad.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6421110/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"travishouze"},"dateCreated":"2018-01-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"I Wish "Mary" Came To the Fight With a Fully Loaded Clip","reviewBody":"By this time, we all know what to expect from a Screen Gems Movie. This is the same studio that has made a living producing small budget films to the urban community like Obsessed, No Good Deed, and When the Bough Breaks. While they have all maintained solid profitability, I have found all of their filmmaking and writing severely lacking any thrills and under utilizing their lead actors. So I found myself walking into Proud Mary expecting a familiar feeling, but a slight sense of naive optimism.

Mary (Taraji P. Henson) plays a hitman who learns she kills the parent of a young boy during a assigned hit. Over the year, she oversees his wellness and takes him in and notices the strain it brings between her and her higher up (Danny Glover) and her previous lover (Billy Brown).

While some of the films budget limits can be seen, the film is able to bring some decent performances from Billy Brown and some decent "gun-fu" action. The finale has a fleeting moment of some engaging action, but it feels all too brief and too dimly lit to take in the stunt's Taraji did. There are fleeting moments when the film is able to not take itself so seriously, particularly one scene when the credits begin to roll which I wish the film committed itself to that certain feeling more often.

While I am not surprised the boss subplot is irrelevant, it still amazes me how little we know about Mary as a character. Her backstory is almost inexistent, which is bothersome given she's such a motherly character but still feels too locked to her own thoughts. The villain's also have no gravitas, as they never physically challenge Mary and feel like faceless dummies to show off Taraji's fighting abilities. And the little boy can be very annoying and all over the place at times. One moment he plays as a hardened street kid and the next a whiny child.

Proud Mary thankfully isn't the disaster I was worried it would be, but it's not as committed to the over the top action I wished it was. While the mother-son dynamic allows for a softer criminal, the emotional impact doesn't feel earned. The 70s music choices are on the nose at times, but loosens up the film at points. To put it simply, Proud Mary comes to the fight strapped with a half empty clip.

Rating: 5.0/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9663,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-01-12","keywords":"hitwoman,woman boy relationship,silencer,assassin,reloading a gun","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1926150425","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWRmMWQ2MTctYzcwYS00MTQ0LWJiMDItMGMyMTBkY2Y2NzYxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTk2ODc0MjY@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWRmMWQ2MTctYzcwYS00MTQ0LWJiMDItMGMyMTBkY2Y2NzYxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTk2ODc0MjY@._V1_.jpg","description":"An assassin meets a young boy who sparks her maternal instinct."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0378245/","name":"Taraji P. Henson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0113117/","name":"Billy Brown"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8091769/","name":"Jahi Di'Allo Winston"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0619836/","name":"Babak Najafi"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010568/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1433517/","name":"John Stuart Newman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1582836/","name":"Christian Swegal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0031078/","name":"Steve Antin"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

While some of the films budget limits can be seen, the film is able to bring some decent performances from Billy Brown and some decent "gun-fu" action. The finale has a fleeting moment of some engaging action, but it feels all too brief and too dimly lit to take in the stunt's Taraji did. There are fleeting moments when the film is able to not take itself so seriously, particularly one scene when the credits begin to roll which I wish the film committed itself to that certain feeling more often.

While I am not surprised the boss subplot is irrelevant, it still amazes me how little we know about Mary as a character. Her backstory is almost inexistent, which is bothersome given she's such a motherly character but still feels too locked to her own thoughts. The villain's also have no gravitas, as they never physically challenge Mary and feel like faceless dummies to show off Taraji's fighting abilities. And the little boy can be very annoying and all over the place at times. One moment he plays as a hardened street kid and the next a whiny child.

Proud Mary thankfully isn't the disaster I was worried it would be, but it's not as committed to the over the top action I wished it was. While the mother-son dynamic allows for a softer criminal, the emotional impact doesn't feel earned. The 70s music choices are on the nose at times, but loosens up the film at points. To put it simply, Proud Mary comes to the fight strapped with a half empty clip.

programme.title: Halloween H20: 20 Years Later
Halloween - 20 lat później
Halloween H20: 20 Years Later
programme.desc:
Halloween H20: 20 Years Later: Directed by Steve Miner. With Jamie Lee Curtis, Adam Arkin, Michelle Williams, Adam Hann-Byrd. Laurie Strode, now the dean of a Northern California private school with an assumed name, must battle the Shape one last time, as the life of her own son hangs in the balance." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120694/","name":"Halloween H20: 20 Years Later","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzA3ZjMzZWItNWUyNy00ZmNiLWIwYmYtN2UxNWUwMGY5Yzc2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Laurie Strode, now the dean of a Northern California private school with an assumed name, must battle the Shape one last time, as the life of her own son hangs in the balance.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120694/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"RyanCShowers"},"dateCreated":"2018-10-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Best Sequel of the Series","reviewBody":""Halloween H20" is the most accomplished sequel of the "Halloween" series, and a film that would deserve a "10" for its potency, conviction, and intelligence if it weren't for a few non-Laurie scenes earlier in the film that feel less than what other films achieved at the time. 

You can't talk about "Halloween H20" without discussing the impact the "Scream" trilogy had on this era in horror cinema. The post-modern references, thrilling and modern style, sexy stars, and heightened feminist protagonists that made the three "Scream" films so successful are borrowed by "Halloween H20" and are used to the film's triumph. 

The single best aspect of "Halloween H20" is Laurie Strode's character development. Though it's a bit more heavy-handed than Sidney in "Scream," it's effective, thorough, and aided by Jamie Lee Curtis' phenomenal, unforgettable portrayal. The last 20 minutes are first-rate 1990s horror. 

"Halloween H20" feels as scary and fresh today as it did in 1998."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":71976,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1998-08-05","keywords":"slasher,call the police,private boarding school,faked death,headmistress","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Halloween H20: 20 Years Later","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1408212505","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGUwNmY1MGUtMWM0ZS00NGQyLWE1OTUtMGIxOWZjOWU5YzA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGUwNmY1MGUtMWM0ZS00NGQyLWE1OTUtMGIxOWZjOWU5YzA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000130/","name":"Jamie Lee Curtis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001326/","name":"Josh Hartnett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0035060/","name":"Adam Arkin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0591171/","name":"Steve Miner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019626/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0091393/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005891/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0384185/","name":"Debra Hill"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000118/","name":"John Carpenter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002526/","name":"Robert Zappia"}],"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"shellemk"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Time flies when you're enjoying yourself","reviewBody":"and each episode speeds along all too quickly! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. Only problem is that living in England, who knows how long after it's shown in the US we'll get to see it! Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"shellemk","dateCreated":"2004-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Time flies when you're enjoying yourself","reviewBody":"and each episode speeds along all too quickly! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. Only problem is that living in England, who knows how long after it's shown in the US we'll get to see it! Fortunately it's worth the wait!","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":134442,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-09-23","keywords":"goth girl,babe scientist,special agent,naval criminal investigative service,police procedural","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001319/","name":"Mark Harmon","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0564724/","name":"David McCallum","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0615266/","name":"Sean Murray"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114905/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066107/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0069074/","name":"Donald P. programme.title: The Pursuit of Happyness
W pogoni za szczęściem
The Pursuit of Happyness
programme.desc:
The Pursuit of Happyness: Directed by Gabriele Muccino. With Will Smith, Jaden Smith, Thandiwe Newton, Brian Howe. A struggling salesman takes custody of his son as he's poised to begin a life-changing professional career." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0454921/","name":"The Pursuit of Happyness","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ5NjQ0NDI3NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDI0MjEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A struggling salesman takes custody of his son as he's poised to begin a life-changing professional career.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0454921/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"AgentDice"},"dateCreated":"2013-10-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"You got a dream... You gotta protect it. People can't do somethin' themselves, they wanna tell you you can't do it. If you want somethin', go get it.","reviewBody":"No one would make a movie about a guy struggling to succeed who doesn't ultimately succeed. Certainly, no one would make a Will Smith movie about a guy who breaks under the strain of his difficult life, abandons his child and dies. That's just not going to happen. And because we know that -- because we've seen more than one movie in our lives -- "The Pursuit of Happiness" has a particular challenge: To take the real-life rags-to-riches story of stockbroker Chris Gardner, a story with a preordained happy ending, and imbue it with tension and suspense.

The great surprise of the picture is that it's not corny. It may have seemed that way from the trailer: Will Smith tells his son, "Don't ever let anyone tell you that you can't do something -- even me." But in context, even that moment isn't cloying. The beauty of the film is its honesty. In its outlines, it's nothing like the usual success story depicted on screen, in which, after a reasonable interval of disappointment, success arrives wrapped in a ribbon and a bow. Instead, this success story follows the pattern most common in life -- it chronicles a series of soul-sickening failures and defeats, missed opportunities, sure things that didn't quite happen, all of which are accompanied by a concomitant accretion of barely perceptible victories that gradually amount to something. In other words, it all feels real.

Gabriele Muccino ("L'Ultimo Bacio") directed it, and his fine Italian hand can be detected in Andrea Guerra's score, with its Italianate wistfulness and whimsicality, and in Muccino's very European enjoyment of American poverty and desperation. He finds both on the streets of San Francisco -- circa 1981, in this case, but some things don't change -- and he films them in a way that we're always aware: Our hero works hard. He's doing everything he can, and he has a son he is raising on his own. Yet even without a false move on his part, just an extra push of bad luck, he might land on those streets, and with such a thud he might never rise.

As in all rags-to-riches tales, we find the protagonist, Chris, unappreciated and looked down upon at the start. He is struggling to make a go of it by selling bone-density scanners and spends his days lugging around a thing that looks like a movie projector case and hearing doctors tell him they're not interested. His wife disdains him. Actually, the treatment of the wife is the first hint that "The Pursuit of Happiness" is going to be an usually uncompromising movie. The wife (Thandie Newton) is a poisonous harpie, with no redeeming traits. The filmmakers are not messing around: Chris has it bad.

In fact, he is an extraordinary man, but no one is paying attention to him long enough to notice. He decides he wants to get an internship as a stockbroker for Dean Witter and, realizing that his resume looks weak, he sets out to meet the man in charge and say a few words on his own behalf. Throughout the film, had Chris had just a little more pride and a little less intelligence, he would blow it. But he remains friendly and resilient, never indulging in anger, never letting anyone else's mistaken perception of him wound him at his core. He stays fixed on his objective and warm in his response to the world -- and even then, things don't improve right away.

Having proceeded to establish Chris as a great guy, "The Pursuit of Happiness" puts him through hell. The wife leaving is just the beginning (actually that seems a little like good luck). Chris has to raise a son (played by Will Smith's own real-life son, Jaden Christopher Syre Smith) and do an unpaid internship, while selling those bone-density scanners on the side. If it weren't for the soup kitchens at Glide Memorial, he and his son often wouldn't eat.

Will Smith has the right quality for the role -- he's an easy man to root for -- but he augments this by channeling some inner quality of desperation and need. Frankly, I don't know where he found it; Smith was touched by luck at a very young age. Yet he does find it. In the taxicab scene, in which he tries to impress a prospective employer by solving the Rubik's Cube, and in every other scene in which Chris has to sit or stand there smiling while another man pronounces on his fate, Smith is right there with the right emotions: absolute hope and total terror.

This film is an amazing heartfelt performance certain to influence and motivate its audience to reach new heights. This film is based on a true gripping and dramatic story about a man who has nothing and his struggle toward success. The plot development can be slow but offers a lot of insight towards character development and explore these themes about patience and success and especially what motivates us and keeps us going. I recommend for everyone to watch this, whether rich businessman, student, or teacher for this will change everyone's perspective on life.

In short - Amazing movie. Very poignant, relevant and uplifting. Leaves you thinking about it for days!!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":481214,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2007-02-07","keywords":"motivational,passion,hardwork,hare krishna,american dream","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Pursuit of Happyness","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1413719065","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWQxODIxNmMtN2ViYi00OTRiLWE4Y2MtZDRiZmE1MDI5ZTVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWQxODIxNmMtN2ViYi00OTRiLWE4Y2MtZDRiZmE1MDI5ZTVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for The Pursuit of Happyness"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0628601/","name":"Thandiwe Newton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1535523/","name":"Jaden Smith"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0610831/","name":"Gabriele Muccino"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0072775/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0175726/","name":"Steve Conrad"}],"duration":"PT1H57M"}</script><metacontent="
