programme.title: Jakubiak lokalnie 3
programme.desc: Tomasz Jakubiak po raz trzeci wyrusza w Polskę, aby odkrywać lokalne smaki i aromaty. Odwiedza różne miejsca i czerpie inspiracje z różnych produktów. Łączy nieznane tradycyjne smaki z kucharską maestrią. Tym razem prowadzący przypomina widzom o istnieniu krajowych serów pleśniowych, tradycyjnych jogurtów oraz doskonałych ziół, rewelacyjnych miodów pitnych a także potraw, które od stuleci przygotowują, mieszkające w naszym kraju mniejszości narodowe.

credits.actor: Maciej Orłowski

programme.title: Zielona rewolucja Marty Dymek
programme.desc: Popularna blogerka Marta Dymek w każdym odcinku próbuje przekonać zaproszonego gościa do kuchni wegetariańskiej. Prowadząca pokaże, jak zastąpić potrawy mięsne ich jarskimi wariacjami.

programme.title: Bitwa na smaki: David vs Matteo 2
programme.desc: Drugi sezon kulinarnych potyczek Davida oraz Matteo. Francuski oraz włoski kucharz po raz kolejny skrzyżują noże i zawalczą o laur pierwszeństwa. Seria obfitować będzie w jeszcze więcej wyzwań, pysznych dań, pojedynków oraz emocji. W rolę sędziów wcielą się zaproszeni do studia goście. Widzowie ponownie będą mieli okazję przekonać się, kto będzie górą Davida oraz jego francuska finezja czy może Matteo ze swoim włoskim temperamentem.

programme.title: Gdzie rosną pieniądze
programme.desc: Praktyczny poradnik w duchu zero waste. Joanna Dymmel, autorka książki "Gdzie rosną pieniądze", udowadnia, że domy i mieszkania są pełne rzeczy, na których można zarobić. W szafach, na pawlaczach, na strychach, w piwnicach czy garażach zalegają przedmioty, które mogą być źródłem dodatkowej gotówki. Prowadząca odwiedzi widzów, by pomóc im wybrać, wycenić i przygotować do sprzedaży rozmaite rzeczy, mogące przynieść zysk bez wychodzenia z domu.

programme.title: Gdzie rosną pieniądze
programme.desc: Praktyczny poradnik w duchu zero waste. Joanna Dymmel, autorka książki "Gdzie rosną pieniądze", udowadnia, że domy i mieszkania są pełne rzeczy, na których można zarobić. W szafach, na pawlaczach, na strychach, w piwnicach czy garażach zalegają przedmioty, które mogą być źródłem dodatkowej gotówki. Prowadząca odwiedzi widzów, by pomóc im wybrać, wycenić i przygotować do sprzedaży rozmaite rzeczy, mogące przynieść zysk bez wychodzenia z domu.

programme.title: Pogotowie remontowe Wieśka 2
programme.desc: Dla wielu ludzi już sama wizja remontu jest niezwykle stresująca. Obawy okazują się uzasadnione, gdy pracownicy niesprawdzonych firm remontowych wyrządzają niewybaczalne szkody. Drugi sezon programu, w którym ceniony specjalista budowlany, Wiesław Skiba, naprawi błędy popełnione przez niekompetentnych kolegów po fachu oraz podpowie widzom, jak samodzielnie uporać się z drobnymi usterkami.

programme.title: Airport
Port lotniczy
Airport
programme.desc: Airport: Directed by George Seaton, Henry Hathaway. With Burt Lancaster, Dean Martin, Jean Seberg, Jacqueline Bisset. A bomber on board an airplane, an airport almost closed by snow, and various personal problems of the people involved." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0065377/","name":"Airport","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTk5NWJkYjItMjA2MC00NThiLWE4NTctOTFlYjcwOTA1YTM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA0MjU0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A bomber on board an airplane, an airport almost closed by snow, and various personal problems of the people involved.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0065377/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Isaac5855"},"dateCreated":"2005-12-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"The First Real "Disaster" Film...","reviewBody":"Another of my guilty pleasures is AIRPORT, the 1970 all-star cast drama based on the best selling novel by Arthur Hailey. This soapy potboiler follows multiple stories throughout a busy metropolitan airport. Subplots that appeared in the book naturally had to be watered down or removed entirely, but that was to be expected in telling a story of such size back in the late 60's. However, after 35 years, I still find this film a lot of fun to watch (even though it really should be experienced in a theater). Burt Lancaster is all stone-faced authority as Mel Bakersfield, the airport manager who neglects his wife (Dana Wynter) while lusting after his passenger relations agent (Jean Seberg). Dean Martin almost gives an actual performance as Vernon Demarest, the smooth-talking pilot who also neglects his wife (Barbara Hale) while having an affair with a stewardess (lovely Jacqueline Bisset)whom he has impregnated. George Kennedy began his long association with the character of Joe Patroni here(he would play the role in three subsequent sequels). Van Heflin is extremely effective as D.O. Guerrero, the sad and twisted man who plans to blow up an airliner. Helen Hayes won an Oscar playing Ada Quonsett, a little old lady who stows away on the plane, but that Oscar should have gone to Maureen Stapleton, who is just devastating as Guerrero's wife, who is totally dismayed about her husband's plan and is tragically heartbreaking during one brief scene near the end of the film. For those who like their adventure films spiced with some somewhat corny, soap suds, put your brain in check and have your fill with AIRPORT.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18652,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"G","genre":["Action","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1970-03-05","keywords":"boeing 707,cockpit,air crew,airport,bomb","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1608826905","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzJhYWQwZTItZjc1NS00NjUzLThhYmMtZDU4NzMxNThlYjJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzJhYWQwZTItZjc1NS00NjUzLThhYmMtZDU4NzMxNThlYjJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A bomber on board an airplane, an airport almost closed by snow, and various personal problems of the people involved."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000044/","name":"Burt Lancaster"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001509/","name":"Dean Martin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001421/","name":"George Kennedy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0780833/","name":"George Seaton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0368871/","name":"Henry Hathaway"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0119020/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0354150/","name":"Arthur Hailey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0780833/","name":"George Seaton"}],"duration":"PT2H17M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Wino truskawkowe
Wino truskawkowe
programme.desc: Wino truskawkowe: Directed by Dariusz Jablonski. With Jirí Machácek, Zuzana Fialová, Marian Dziedziel, Mieczyslaw Grabka. This is not a love story though it is full of love. It is not a comedy though the characters often say funny things. It is not a detective story even though the hero is trying to solve a murder. It is not a nature drama though it shows the splendid colours and customs of the countryside. It is not a musical though Lubica expresses her longing in a passionate dance. Nor is it a film about ghosts though a ghost does ask the hero for a favour. A few draughts of Strawberry Wine are enough to take us into a magical world in the true centre of Europe, where love, crime and penitence are just as much a part of life as the changing of the seasons, the migration of birds or the flowing of a mountain stream." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1260596/","name":"Wino truskawkowe","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTI5MjU4YjUtNGJkNy00Nzk2LTgyYWEtMDk0OTBmY2NmZTYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTgyNDg0NTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is not a love story though it is full of love. IMDb data; ttnr: 1260596, Title: Wino truskawkowe, --- Description: Wino truskawkowe: Directed by Dariusz Jablonski. With Jirí Machácek, Zuzana Fialová, Marian Dziedziel, Mieczyslaw Grabka. This is not a love story though it is full of love. It is not a comedy though the characters often say funny things. It is not a detective story even though the hero is trying to solve a murder. It is not a nature drama though it shows the splendid colours and customs of the countryside. It is not a musical though Lubica expresses her longing in a passionate dance. Nor is it a film about ghosts though a ghost does ask the hero for a favour. A few draughts of Strawberry Wine are enough to take us into a magical world in the true centre of Europe, where love, crime and penitence are just as much a part of life as the changing of the seasons, the migration of birds or the flowing of a mountain stream." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1260596/","name":"Wino truskawkowe","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTI5MjU4YjUtNGJkNy00Nzk2LTgyYWEtMDk0OTBmY2NmZTYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTgyNDg0NTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is not a love story though it is full of love. programme.title: O co biega?
programme.desc: W magazynie nowinki oraz praktyczne porady dla osób, które uprawiają bieganie rekreacyjnie, półprofesjonalnie, zawodowo lub dopiero zaczynają. Gospodarz programu Marcin Rosłoń wraz z ekspertami będzie podpowiadał, jak przygotować się do biegania amatorskiego i zawodowego, jak dobrać odpowiedni sprzęt lub przygotować się do maratonu. W programie nie zabraknie również ciekawostek, rozmów ze sportowcami i osobami z show-biznesu, które opowiedzą o swojej pasji do biegania.

programme.title: As Gouda as it Gets
Gouda i miłość
As Gouda as It Gets
programme.desc: As Gouda as it Gets: Directed by Anne De Léan. With Kim Shaw, Clayton James, Tara Joshi, Romaine Waite. Artisan cheese shop owner Brie finds herself competing for a $50,000 prize in her town's annual Cheese Festival. To boost her presence, she teams up with an influential cheese critic to profile her vintage smoked gouda. As their friendship develops into romance, a competitor's business proposal and unforeseen complications force Brie to put her shop - and heart - on the line." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt13176206/","name":"As Gouda as it Gets","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDQ2YjVkOGMtNzE3NC00MmU0LTk3ZWEtOGE5OGU4NjljOGM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTk1NzUwMA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Artisan cheese shop owner Brie finds herself competing for a $50,000 prize in her town's annual Cheese Festival. programme.title: Niezapomniane filmy o Bożym Narodzeniu
programme.desc: Grono krytyków rozmawia o najlepszych w historii kina opowieściach wigilijnych. Są to wzruszające, zabawne oraz zaskakujące produkcje, których tłem jest, nie zawsze białe, Boże Narodzenie. Wśród nich znajduje się m.in. film "Fanny i Aleksander" oraz "To wspaniałe życie".

programme.title: Hardwired

Actually all the characters are funny, as if they were a parody of themselves. I don't know if they were so bored to play such boring roles, or the script was too lame, or the director was sleeping in a corner during all the shooting, but this acting, and this entire movie is actually a shame for anyone who was involved in the making. programme.title: Scoob
Listy do M. 4
programme.desc:
Scoob!: Directed by Tony Cervone. With Will Forte, Mark Wahlberg, Jason Isaacs, Gina Rodriguez. Scooby and the gang face their most challenging mystery ever: a plot to unleash the ghost dog Cerberus upon the world. As they race to stop this dogpocalypse, the gang discovers that Scooby has an epic destiny greater than anyone imagined." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3152592/","name":"Scoob!","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTJmODM0MDQtMTRjYy00YWZjLThjODItMzQ5N2I2NDBjYzA1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDA4NzMyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Scooby and the gang face their most challenging mystery ever: a plot to unleash the ghost dog Cerberus upon the world. As they race to stop this dogpocalypse, the gang discovers that Scooby has an epic destiny greater than anyone ima","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3152592/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"alv790"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"if you want a Scooby movie, this is not it","reviewBody":"It started well, with a touching scene of the main characters meeting for the forst time as kids (or puppies, in Scooby's case) and then having one of their traditional adventures. However, this only lasts 15 minutes, and from there the movie stops being a Scooby Doo movie and starts being a superhero movie, with Dick Dastardly as the supervillain, and Blue Falcon and his gang as superheroes, with the Scooby gang stuck there in a movie that is not their own.

Because let's face it, just like in a James Bond movie we have certain expectations, in a Scoob movie we also have expectations, and they are not met. That distinctive type of adventures where they explore a haunted location and, after many scares, end up discovering that it was all a not supernatural trick by some criminal, is not here, except for a brief nod at the beginning. Instead, we get a generic modern children's movie, with characters running around from chase to chase, battle to battle and explosion to explosion without a compelling plot, while making pop culture references. The plot involves saving the world from a large-scale supernatural threat (really supernatural, none of the subversion characteristic of the source material).

So, if we forget about wanting a Scooby Doo movie and focus on the movie we get, it's not very good either. You can see where they try to have jokes for the adult watchers, but they lack the wit and talent to make them funny. They occasionally remember that this is supposed to be a Scooby Doo movie, and they have traditional gags like having Scooby and Shaggy, in the middle of being chased by the critters, turn around and serve the critters as waiters, disconcerting them for a while, but it's too little and done without much talent. You also get a scene where two male characters fight and a female character says it's toxic masculinity, which is kind of a hateful message to send to children.

In short, if you want a Scooby movie, this is not it, and if you want a generic modern kid's movie, this is not a good one."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":24305,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2020-05-15","keywords":"shared universe,scooby doo character,great dane,cartoon dog,dog","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Final Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2309144089","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTFmN2FkYTItODA3Ny00YzY5LWFmODEtNDlhZjE4YjgwY2VhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTFmN2FkYTItODA3Ny00YzY5LWFmODEtNDlhZjE4YjgwY2VhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"Mystery loves company. Watch the new trailer for #SCOOB!"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0287182/","name":"Will Forte"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000242/","name":"Mark Wahlberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005042/","name":"Jason Isaacs"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0148999/","name":"Tony Cervone"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0468593/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024579/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1186373/","name":"Adam Sztykiel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3242555/","name":"Jack C. programme.title: Stalked by My Doctor: Just What the Doctor Ordered
programme.desc: Doktorowi Albertowi Beckowi (Eric Roberts) udaje się uciec z więzienia dla psychicznie chorych. Mężczyzna znajduje schronienie w pustym domu, ale sielanka kończy się, kiedy wprowadzają się nowi lokatorzy. Albert musi skryć się na strychu. Stamtąd z zainteresowaniem przygląda się życiu rodziny, szczególną uwagą obdarza zaś osiemnastoletnią córkę właścicielki. Nietypowy film z humorystycznymi akcentami.

programme.title: Pornografia
Pornografia
programme.desc:
Pornografia: Directed by Jan Jakub Kolski. With Krzysztof Majchrzak, Adam Ferency, Krzysztof Globisz, Grazyna Blecka-Kolska. Two intellectuals, a writer and a director, begin to play a mysterious psychological game in a peaceful countryside manor house during the Nazi occupation." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0357037/","name":"Pornografia","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkyNTY3ODE2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODMwNTQ4Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two intellectuals, a writer and a director, begin to play a mysterious psychological game in a peaceful countryside manor house during the Nazi occupation.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0357037/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Mengedegna"},"dateCreated":"2003-10-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Spielberg should sue","reviewBody":"What on earth could have possessed the NY Film Festival selection committee to inflict this pretentious, boring, derivative, ugly and silly piece of third-rate filmmaking on its audience? Because it's Polish and we haven't had a lot of worthwhile Polish movies since Kieslowski? Has it come to that?

The film takes Witold Gombrowicz's long-winded but intermittently fascinating classic novel and superimposes a gratuitous (and fatuous) Spielbergesque holocaust plot line, to make it all, I guess, more compelling. The effect is glaringly contrived and (as with the far better Spielberg original) offensively trivializing.

In case anyone misses the point, the holocaust plot overlay involves a doomed little girl and, at the dénouement, a shift to a black-and-white background against which is displayed, in color, a talismanic link to her. Sound familiar? Spielberg should sue.

The sad thing is that there is some talent at work here. Though the plot is gratuitously confusing, meandering, and contrived, the use of a country house around which a low-intensity conflict between Germans and Polish partisans swirls obliquely is effective, with the fighting intruding suddenly into and then just as suddenly vanishing from the playing out of the protagonists' humdrum idleness and self-absorption. Grayzna Blecka-Kolska gives a performance that almost transcends the clichés written into her role as the quietly tipsy châtelaine, and the two young people who are the objects of the middle-aged protagonists' dirty-old-man obsessions (Gombrowicz's central plot line, if no longer Kolski's) look as if they might have been far more effectively used in some other movie, one in which they were given something to do beyond standing around and looking beautiful (which they are, it should be said). But on the whole, this is an over-the-top, pretentious dud, the sort of thing that should be seen only by the paid critics who then have a professional obligation and civic duty to spare all the rest of us such an irritating waste of our time.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":940,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Romance","War"],"datePublished":"2003-10-17","keywords":"sex standing up,lift skirt,panties hit the floor,panties pulled down,fondling","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0538048/","name":"Krzysztof Majchrzak"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0272295/","name":"Adam Ferency"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0322937/","name":"Krzysztof Globisz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0464383/","name":"Jan Jakub Kolski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043688/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0090290/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0094194/","name":"Luc Bondy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0102722/","name":"Gérard Brach"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0326822/","name":"Witold Gombrowicz"}],"duration":"PT1H57M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The East
Ida
programme.desc: The East: Directed by Zal Batmanglij. With Brit Marling, Alexander Skarsgård, Elliot Page, Toby Kebbell. An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1869716/","name":"The East","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYwNTk0NTEwOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDMzNDUyOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1869716/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"beyonder-3"},"dateCreated":"2013-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Makes you think!","reviewBody":"This is a movie in which you debate with yourself, where would you draw the line in search of justice against greedy corporations, if that corporations inflicted on you the kind of damage they did on the characters of this movie. Knowing that it was inspired by actual actions that some corporations have taken, just makes us think even harder on whats going on in our world. The acting is very good, everyone plays their character very well. You just have to feel sympathy for all of the character especially "Doc". I recommend anyone who wants to see a movie which gives you something important to think about to watch this. programme.title: Hardwired
Amelia Earhart
Amelia
programme.desc: Hardwired: Directed by Ernie Barbarash. With Cuba Gooding Jr., Val Kilmer, Michael Ironside, Tatiana Maslany. After a tragic accident nearly claims Luke Gibson's life the Hexx Corporation hardwire an implant into his brain to save him, but Luke soon finds out that this new technology comes at price." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1405412/","name":"Hardwired","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWUyYjMwMDAtMmExYS00NWU0LWE5OWEtMmZlZWM3ZmFkYmUwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"After a tragic accident nearly claims Luke Gibson's life the Hexx Corporation hardwire an implant into his brain to save him, but Luke soon finds out that this new technology comes at price.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1405412/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"pistu34"},"dateCreated":"2009-10-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"ohhh pleeease..","reviewBody":"... this movie is soooo bad. I could tell you why, but it does not worth the words. Just spare your time and avoid it. It't lame and tells nothing new. :( Kilmer's character's hair is so funny that I was laughing for three minutes when he appeared in the movie... Actually all the characters are funny, as if they were a parody of themselves. I don't know if they were so bored to play such boring roles, or the script was too lame, or the director was sleeping in a corner during all the shooting, but this acting, and this entire movie is actually a shame for anyone who was involved in the making. Believe me, If you watch it, you will regret it in the end.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4270,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2009-11-03","keywords":"deception,memory chip,memory,false memory,repressed memory","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Hardwired","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi364184857","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUyMTEzNDg5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDY2NjM4MjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUyMTEzNDg5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDY2NjM4MjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After a tragic accident claims the lives of Luke Gibson's (Gooding Jr.) wife and unborn child, he is left with critical injuries and complete amnesia. A new technological breakthrough from the Hexx Corporation - a Psi-Comp Implant that's hardwired into Luke's brain - saves his life, but Luke soon finds out that this new technology comes with a price and that the Hexx Corporation harbors sinister plans for the new device. With the help of new allies, Luke tries to recover the memories of his past while uncovering the Hexx Corporation's true motives."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000421/","name":"Cuba Gooding Jr."},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000174/","name":"Val Kilmer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000461/","name":"Michael Ironside"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0053228/","name":"Ernie Barbarash"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0222021/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0086887/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0071430/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0403629/","name":"Michael Hurst"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Sting
Żądło
The Sting
programme.desc:
The Sting: Directed by George Roy Hill. With Paul Newman, Robert Redford, Robert Shaw, Charles Durning. Two grifters team up to pull off the ultimate con." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0070735/","name":"The Sting","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU3NjQ4YTMtZGJjOS00YTQ3LThmNmItMTI5MDE2ODI3NzY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjUzOTY1NTc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two grifters team up to pull off the ultimate con.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0070735/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"JamesHitchcock"},"dateCreated":"2004-03-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Moral Order Restored","reviewBody":"Johnny Hooker and Luther Coleman are `grifters' or confidence tricksters in 1930s Chicago. Unknown to them, however, one of their victims works for a vicious local gangster named Doyle Lonnegan, and when Lonnegan finds out what has happened he has Luther murdered. Hooker is not a violent man by nature and admits that he does not know much about killing, but nevertheless wishes to take revenge for his partner's death. He decides that the best way is to hurt Lonnegan's pride by relieving him of some of his wealth. He joins forces with another con man named Henry Gondorff, and together they come up with an elaborate plan, not only to cheat Lonnegan, but also to do it in such a way that he never realises that he has been cheated. The plot unfolds with great ingenuity; until the final denouement the audience are never quite sure which developments are for real and which are part of the elaborate scheme.

Crime thrillers set during this period are normally associated with the classic `film noir' style, with its dark, brooding, cynical atmosphere. In `The Sting', however, George Roy Hill deliberately sets out to create a very different mood. The style is almost the exact opposite of film noir. The acting is heavily stylised (as is the scenery), and the division of the film into sections with titles such as `The Hook' or `The Line' is reminiscent of the formal division of a stage play into acts and scenes. The film is not in black-and-white but in bright colour, and the mood, far from being heavy and brooding, is light and cheerful. Scott Joplin's music, although written slightly earlier than the period in which the film is set, fits this mood perfectly. The major actors all play their parts perfectly- Robert Shaw as the glowering, menacing Lonnegan, Robert Redford as the young, idealistic Hooker (insofar as a con-man can be said to be an idealist), and Paul Newman as the older, more experienced and laid-back Gondorff. There are also good contributions from Charles Durning as the corrupt policement Lieutenant Snyder and Robert Earl Jones as Luther.

Despite the cheerful mood, the film has serious undertones in keeping with its themes of revenge and murder. I am not usually a great admirer of what are known as `heist' or `caper' movies, as I feel that too often they glamourise crime and dishonesty. `The Sting', however, is different. Hooker and Gondorff live in a world where the moral order has broken down. The police are hopelessly corrupt- Snyder, the one representative we see of the forces of law and order, is on Lonnegan's payroll. There is no chance of Hooker getting justice for his friend's murder through the normal channels; the only way in which this can be achieved is to go outside the law. Where the police are crooked, only the criminals can execute justice. The emotional satisfaction we feel at the end of the film is because a sort of moral order has finally been restored and, moreover, because this has been done without anyone getting injured except Lonnegan's wallet. An excellent film, which well deserved its Academy Award. 9/10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":253115,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.3},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1973-12-25","keywords":"con,con man,illegal activity,playing golf,con artist","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Sting","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2717122841","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM5ZDllM2QtZjg2MS00NjA1LWE2ZTEtNmU2MTBkM2U2MDNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM5ZDllM2QtZjg2MS00NjA1LWE2ZTEtNmU2MTBkM2U2MDNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Studios Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000056/","name":"Paul Newman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000602/","name":"Robert Redford"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001727/","name":"Robert Shaw"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001351/","name":"George Roy Hill"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019166/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911486/","name":"David S. Ward"}],"duration":"PT2H9M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Les vétos: Directed by Julie Manoukian. With Clovis Cornillac, Noémie Schmidt, Carole Franck, Matthieu Sampeur. In the heart of Morvan, Nico, the last vet in the area, struggles to save his patients, his clinic, and his family. When Michel, his partner and mentor, announces his retirement, Nico knows that the hard part is yet to come. "Don't worry, I've found the next generation'' Except that ... The next generation is Alexandra, a 24-hour graduate, brilliant, misanthropic, and not at all willing to return to bury herself in the village of her childhood. The Last Champion
programme.desc: The Last Shift: Directed by Andrew Cohn. With Richard Jenkins, Shane Paul McGhie, Da'Vine Joy Randolph, Ed O'Neill. Stanley's last shift at his fast food job takes an unexpected turn when he befriends a young African-American work employee." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10661180/","name":"The Last Shift","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjZlYTVkZTMtY2IwNC00MmRiLWEyMjUtZWNmOTY4NjdiOWQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Stanley's last shift at his fast food job takes an unexpected turn when he befriends a young African-American work employee.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10661180/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"michael-chesser-906-654605"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"The race thing is so old and played-out, but","reviewBody":"This story was written with a quill (or disposable Bic) not a sledge hammer. While it has the predictable white = bad, black = good thing happening, the story is actually new (to me, on film). Growing up, going through my first part-time jobs, I always ran into older people who unaccountably had the same responsibilities as I did. I didn't necessarily pity them, but I was curious about them. This film gives "that guy" some dimension, a life. I also like that the younger character can get in cross-ways with the law without being a thug. That's probably a lot more common than we know. It's not a story to change your life, but it is a thoughtful piece all the same.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2197,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-09-25","keywords":"food,f word,father son relationship,no opening credits","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3735339289","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDY4YzMyMDAtMTg3NS00NDUwLWEzMjItYTc2ODZiNGM4NmZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDY4YzMyMDAtMTg3NS00NDUwLWEzMjItYTc2ODZiNGM4NmZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"Stanley (Richard Jenkins), an aging fast-food worker, plans to call it quits after 38 years on the graveyard shift at Oscar's Chicken and Fish. His last weekend takes a turn while training his replacement, Jevon (Shane Paul McGhie), a talented but stalled young writer whose provocative politics keep landing him in trouble."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0420955/","name":"Richard Jenkins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6341784/","name":"Shane Paul McGhie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5007768/","name":"Da'Vine Joy Randolph"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3829351/","name":"Andrew Cohn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0063938/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0041698/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0109361/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3829351/","name":"Andrew Cohn"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Words on Bathroom Walls
Przewrotny umysł
Words on Bathroom Walls
programme.desc:
Words on Bathroom Walls: Directed by Thor Freudenthal. With Charlie Plummer, Andy Garcia, Taylor Russell, AnnaSophia Robb. Diagnosed with a mental illness halfway through his senior year of high school, a witty, introspective teen struggles to keep it a secret while falling in love with a brilliant classmate who inspires him to not be defined by his condition." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8045906/","name":"Words on Bathroom Walls","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTJmNTNlZDEtM2JjNy00MmNmLTgzNWItN2VlZGNlNjM1YjFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTExMDk0NzQ3._V1_.jpg","description":"Diagnosed with a mental illness halfway through his senior year of high school, a witty, introspective teen struggles to keep it a secret while falling in love with a brilliant classmate who inspires him to not be defined by his cond","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8045906/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ferguson-6"},"dateCreated":"2020-08-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"a new way of looking at it","reviewBody":"Greetings again from the darkness. Very little outside 'the norm' is required for teenagers to ostracize one of their own. Sometimes it's a haircut or a brand of shoes, or even some other minor detail that sets them apart. But when it's a mental illness, the tribe can be merciless. Director Thor Freudenthal (DIARY OF A WIMPY KID, 2010) takes on Julia Walton's 2017 novel, with a screenplay from Nick Naveda. The film features two rising young stars and addresses some of the challenges brought on by the uncertainties associated with a mental illness.

Charlie Plummer (so terrific in LEAN ON PETE, 2018) stars as Adam, a high school senior who has dealt with the challenges of undiagnosed mental health issues since he was quite young. His father abandoned the family years ago, and Adam's devoted mother (Molly Parker, "House of Cards") is not only patient and loving, but also committed to researching any possible treatment that would lead Adam to a better life. On the other hand, Adam and his mother's new live-in lover Paul (Walton Goggins) don't exactly see eye-to-eye on things, leading to more anxiety for Adam.

In an interesting and unique approach, director Freudenthal allows us to not only hear the voices Adam hears, but also see the hallucinations and visions he sees - three of whom are Rebecca (AnnaSophia Robb, THE WAY WAY BACK), a sweet, hippie-ish optimist; The Bodyguard (Lobo Sebastian), a cigar-chomping, bat swinging he-man; and Joaquin (Devon Bostick), an inappropriately horny 'best friend from a 90's move." On top of that, there is a black mist that periodically manifests, enveloping Adam and bringing on crippling fear and isolation. After a years-long stream of drug therapy, Adam is pronounced "treatment resistant" and diagnosed as schizophrenic. Adam's only mind-calming escape is when he's cooking. He knows his way around the kitchen and his goal is to attend Culinary School after graduation.

One day, Adam has a psychotic break during Chemistry class. He gets expelled, which jeopardizes his Culinary School dream. His mother gets him admitted to a Catholic School run by Sister Catherine (Beth Grant) at the same time he is accepted into an experimental drug trial. He's allowed to stay in school as long as he takes his meds and maintains his grades. It's here where he meets the dynamic Maya (Taylor Russell (WAVES, 2019). Maya is smart and ambitious and proud, and the two quickly form a bond - an interesting bond between two smart high school kids carrying their own burdens and holding their own secrets.

Sister Catherine is balancing the specific needs of Adam with her responsibility to the school, and then there is also prom and graduation to deal with. With the new drug, the voices and visions disappear, but Adam has some issues with the side effects. A desperate plea for help from Father Patrick (Andy Garcia), the school priest, provides a boost as Adam tells him, "It's nice to be listened to and not just observed." That line provides significant insight into what it's like to have this affliction, and that's really where the movie excels ... putting us in the shoes of a schizophrenic and allowing us to experience the good and bad moments. What can Adam trust? His eyes? His ears? His mind?

Adam and Maya are both trying to figure out who they are, at the same time learning what it really means to love someone. Adam refers to his illness as his "burgeoning insanity", and in fact, schizophrenia does have a history of accelerating over time once it strikes a young person. The movie succeeds in taking away some of the mystique of mental illness, by making it approachable and something we want to better understand. There is a visual reference to Van Gogh's "Starry Night" that might be a bit too "nail on the head", but Freudenthal's movie is profound and features two very talented young actors. The humanity beneath the surface of those society would rather pretend don't exist is effectively compared to those stricken with cancer ... those we would do anything for. I watched this film back-to-back with another teen-drama-romance new release entitled CHEMICAL HEARTS, and it's extremely rare to find two such thought-provoking films centered on a pair of high school students ... but quite a treat (although I believe all 4 actors are long past high school age).","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8066,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-08-21","keywords":"based on young adult novel,schizophrenia,hallucination,hospital,restraint","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Watch Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3428105753","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjFiNDU4MzQtOGIzMS00ZGRmLWIzNTYtYmZjNmFhOGZlYzRhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjFiNDU4MzQtOGIzMS00ZGRmLWIzNTYtYmZjNmFhOGZlYzRhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A teenager coping with paranoid schizophrenia hopes his new experimental drug treatment will help him navigate high school and the outside world."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4055138/","name":"Charlie Plummer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000412/","name":"Andy Garcia"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5347988/","name":"Taylor Russell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0294457/","name":"Thor Freudenthal"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0811450/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0192696/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4550950/","name":"Nick Naveda"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9649443/","name":"Julia Walton"}],"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

Pesti balhé
programme.desc: Pesti balhé: Directed by Balázs Lóth. With Béla Mészáros, Andrea Petrik, Ferenc Elek, Simon Szabó. After their friend dies in an accident, Marcell, the rich but burnt-out architect and the rest of his loser childhood buddies decide to team up for the last time to fulfill their friend's last wish by smuggling his crappy painting into the most prestigious art auction of Budapest." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10319486/","name":"Pesti balhé","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzRmOWM2YjctODRkOC00MDgyLWIwNGUtZjNlMGVmZDgwMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTgzOTI4MzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"After their friend dies in an accident, Marcell, the rich but burnt-out architect and the rest of his loser childhood buddies decide to team up for the last time to fulfill their friend's last wish by smuggling his crappy painting in","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10319486/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"spidermensch"},"dateCreated":"2020-08-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"A funny movie","reviewBody":"A refreshing movie for me as a foreign student. I rarely do much in my free time, so when this came out especially now, during the COVID, I went to see with English subtitles. The plot was pretty surprising. A drug dependent young man faces his past and his inner demons after he is interned in an institution for addicted." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0427543/","name":"A Million Little Pieces","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDhhMTA3ODYtZGEzZC00MzgwLWEyYzktZjVkMDlkYmRjMTU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg2NjQwMDQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A drug dependent young man faces his past and his inner demons after he is interned in an institution for addicted.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0427543/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ciffou"},"dateCreated":"2020-04-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pretentious film school project","reviewBody":"I don't undestand why they decided to make a movie adaptation out of the book instead of the controversy surrounding its publication. I assume they expected this movie to be an award winning project: nudity, check; tears, check; redemption arc, check; artsy shots out of nowhere, check. They even throw a couple of scientologists to the mix! programme.title: Together Together
Umowa na zawsze
Together Together
programme.desc:
Together Together: Directed by Nikole Beckwith. With Patti Harrison, Ed Helms, Rosalind Chao, Timm Sharp. When a young loner becomes the gestational surrogate for a single man in his 40s, the two strangers come to realize this unexpected relationship will challenge their perceptions of connection, boundaries and the particulars of love." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11285280/","name":"Together Together","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTI5MmQ0M2UtMjZkZC00Mjk1LTljZmItN2ZlYzQ3MDdkZTQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyMjM2NDc2._V1_.jpg","description":"When a young loner becomes the gestational surrogate for a single man in his 40s, the two strangers come to realize this unexpected relationship will challenge their perceptions of connection, boundaries and the particulars of love.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11285280/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Erik-Movie-Reviews"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Very Mediocre Production Without an Ending","reviewBody":"In spite of attempting to poorly imitate the lettering and typeface of Woody Allen cinematography, found the negative references to Woody Allen and his Oscar winning productions - Annie Hall and Manhattan to be both unnecessary and in poor taste. Unlike the creators of Together, Together , Woody Allen clearly knows how to make a movie.

The acting in this movie and both leads were very good. Unfortunately the writing and story line fell flat, and the expectation that today's audience would bat an eye at a 25 year old woman having a child with a 45 year old man seems out of touch with reality and today's world. With different filmmakers this could have been an interesting production.

The lack of an ending was also a great disappointment.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4975,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2021-04-23","keywords":"surrogate,title spoken in dialogue,coffee shop,teddy bear,doctor's visit","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi444842009","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWQ5MGNiYzMtN2ExZS00NTVlLThiMGQtMzUyYzE0NjlkZDU5XkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWQ5MGNiYzMtN2ExZS00NTVlLThiMGQtMzUyYzE0NjlkZDU5XkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg","description":"When young loner Anna is hired as the gestational surrogate for Matt, a single man in his 40s who wants a child, the two strangers come to realize this unexpected relationship will quickly challenge their perceptions of connection, boundaries and the particulars of love."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8773928/","name":"Patti Harrison"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1159180/","name":"Ed Helms"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001034/","name":"Rosalind Chao"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2859868/","name":"Nikole Beckwith"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0491312/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0588086/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0386393/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2859868/","name":"Nikole Beckwith"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

When a young loner becomes the gestational surrogate for a single man in his 40s, the two strangers come to realize this unexpected relationship will challenge their perceptions of connection, boundaries and the particulars of love." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11285280/","name":"Together Together","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTI5MmQ0M2UtMjZkZC00Mjk1LTljZmItN2ZlYzQ3MDdkZTQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyMjM2NDc2._V1_.jpg","description":"When a young loner becomes the gestational surrogate for a single man in his 40s, the two strangers come to realize this unexpected relationship will challenge their perceptions of connection, boundaries and the particulars of love.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11285280/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Erik-Movie-Reviews","dateCreated":"2021-05-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Very Mediocre Production Without an Ending","reviewBody":"In spite of attempting to poorly imitate the lettering and typeface of Woody Allen cinematography, found the negative references to Woody Allen and his Oscar winning productions - Annie Hall and Manhattan to be both unnecessary and in poor taste. Unlike the creators of Together, Together , Woody Allen clearly knows how to make a movie.

The acting in this movie and both leads were very good. Unfortunately the writing and story line fell flat, and the expectation that today's audience would bat an eye at a 25 year old woman having a child with a 45 year old man seems out of touch with reality and today's world. With different filmmakers this could have been an interesting production.

The lack of an ending was also a great disappointment.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4975,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2021-04-23","keywords":"surrogate,title spoken in dialogue,coffee shop,teddy bear,doctor's visit","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi444842009","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWQ5MGNiYzMtN2ExZS00NTVlLThiMGQtMzUyYzE0NjlkZDU5XkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWQ5MGNiYzMtN2ExZS00NTVlLThiMGQtMzUyYzE0NjlkZDU5XkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg","description":"When young loner Anna is hired as the gestational surrogate for Matt, a single man in his 40s who wants a child, the two strangers come to realize this unexpected relationship will quickly challenge their perceptions of connection, boundaries and the particulars of love.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8773928/","name":"Patti Harrison","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1159180/","name":"Ed Helms","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001034/","name":"Rosalind Chao"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2859868/","name":"Nikole Beckwith"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0491312/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0588086/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0386393/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2859868/","name":"Nikole Beckwith"],"duration":"PT1H30M"</script><metacontent="

Separated from his Syrian family, he is stuck on a remote Scottish island awaiting the fate of his asylum request." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9138170/","name":"Limbo","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjBiMDJkMzAtMTVhYi00NDFkLTliMTYtYTM4M2I1OGZmNDllXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM2NDM2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Omar is a promising young musician. Separated from his Syrian family, he is stuck on a remote Scottish island awaiting the fate of his asylum request.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9138170/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MiguelAReina"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great story","reviewBody":"Almost turned into Aki Kaurismaki's pupil, the Scottish director manages to create a fun, moving and profound story about the refugee drama. programme.desc: A Million Little Pieces: Directed by Sam Taylor-Johnson. With Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Billy Bob Thornton, Odessa Young, Giovanni Ribisi. A drug dependent young man faces his past and his inner demons after he is interned in an institution for addicted." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0427543/","name":"A Million Little Pieces","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDhhMTA3ODYtZGEzZC00MzgwLWEyYzktZjVkMDlkYmRjMTU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg2NjQwMDQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A drug dependent young man faces his past and his inner demons after he is interned in an institution for addicted.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0427543/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ciffou"},"dateCreated":"2020-04-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pretentious film school project","reviewBody":"I don't undestand why they decided to make a movie adaptation out of the book instead of the controversy surrounding its publication. That would have been far more interesting. This movie is the poor man's Xavier Dolan film - and even his "artsy" shots are obnoxious enough. I assume they expected this movie to be an award winning project: nudity, check; tears, check; redemption arc, check; artsy shots out of nowhere, check. They even throw a couple of scientologists to the mix! Overall its plot is as basic and predictable as you would expect it to be had it been made during the 90s."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2692,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-12-06","keywords":"male full frontal nudity,title directed by female,shower,drugs,addiction","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"A Million Little Pieces","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3980442649","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjdhNGU1ZmMtMjVmNS00NjdmLWJkOTgtY2JkNzVkMDg4ZjY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjdhNGU1ZmMtMjVmNS00NjdmLWJkOTgtY2JkNzVkMDg4ZjY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 1"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1093951/","name":"Aaron Taylor-Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000671/","name":"Billy Bob Thornton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3747611/","name":"Odessa Young"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0853374/","name":"Sam Taylor-Johnson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0554532/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0583900/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051618/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1093951/","name":"Aaron Taylor-Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0853374/","name":"Sam Taylor-Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0294580/","name":"James Frey"}],"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The War of the Roses
Wojna państwa Rose
The War of the Roses
programme.desc:
The War of the Roses: Directed by Danny DeVito. With Michael Douglas, Kathleen Turner, Danny DeVito, Marianne Sägebrecht. A married couple try everything to get each other to leave the house in a vicious divorce battle." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0098621/","name":"The War of the Roses","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGMxOWM5ZWQtYmYyOC00OGE2LWFhODItNzcyZmYyZDBhMjdkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA0MjU0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A married couple try everything to get each other to leave the house in a vicious divorce battle.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0098621/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"edge547"},"dateCreated":"2017-05-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"The best of its kind","reviewBody":"The premise is simple enough: a moderately wealthy couple—whose last name is Rose—decides to get divorced after many years of marriage. But neither of them wants to give up their house, and both remain living in it, getting on each other's nerves as they deliberately and maliciously annoy and attack each other, each in an attempt to get the other to give up and leave.

It's exactly the sort of film I don't normally enjoy, where two equally detestable parties go back and forth trying to one up each other with ridiculous shenanigans that are rarely funny and never make up for the ninety minutes of wasted time. It reminds me of dumb comedy films like Duplex—which pits neighbor against neighbor—and Are We There Yet?, in which Ice Cube goes up against his new girlfriend's mischievous kids. These sorts of films aren't typically my cup of tea, but it wasn't my turn to pick the movie, so I just sat back and watched.

And then a funny thing occurred. Almost immediately, I got drawn into the story. That wasn't supposed to happen, but it did, and I was pleasantly surprised. I normally don't even care for Danny DeVito as a director, probably due to the fact that he made the awful Duplex, which I mentioned earlier. I mean, I did enjoy Matilda, but that was a family movie that I watched as a kid. War of the Roses was something else entirely, and despite my efforts, I couldn't help but enjoying it.

It tells the story in a different way than others of its kind. Things unfold naturally and totally believably. Sure, some of the stunts that the characters pull reach the same levels of ridiculousness as in those other films that I didn't like, but here we get the impression that it's done for the sake of the story, rather than for just another cheap laugh. Instead of yawning, I was wide sitting wide-eyed on the edge of my seat. It's not just funny; it's also very real and poignant, especially considering the fact that most of us know someone who's had a really tough divorce and it's easy to see how things could go just as bad as they do in War of the Roses.

And, unlike most of these kinds of movies and apart from my expectations, we actually end up caring about the characters, despite their overabundance of flaws. They're both selfish idiots, which makes the story so much better, but they're still believable and very well acted. From moment to moment we find ourselves siding with each one. Neither of them could be called true protagonists, as they constantly antagonize each other, but there's a balance of both deserved animosity and loathsomeness between them that is very well done. They got good actors to play these roles, and they play them so well that we almost don't notice that it could have been much worse in the hands of anyone else.

The whole story is told by Danny DeVito, who plays a divorce attorney who is telling it as a warning to a prospective client who never says a word during the entire film. And the ending is great. I won't spoil it, but trust me, it's a good one. This definitely isn't the best film I've seen, but it's certainly the best of its kind, and makes me reconsider my attitude toward this type of film. I just thought the whole idea was bad, but it turns out that it's often just done very poorly.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":51509,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"1989-12-08","keywords":"marital argument,sexuality,marital problem,embarrassment,gymnastics","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The War of the Roses","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1107034393","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDlhNmQ4NTYtODk4MS00NTRjLWFjMzAtZDhhMjBkMmM4YmM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDlhNmQ4NTYtODk4MS00NTRjLWFjMzAtZDhhMjBkMmM4YmM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000140/","name":"Michael Douglas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000678/","name":"Kathleen Turner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000362/","name":"Danny DeVito"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000362/","name":"Danny DeVito"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035761/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023875/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0012258/","name":"Warren Adler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0498775/","name":"Michael Leeson"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

It's exactly the sort of film I don't normally enjoy, where two equally detestable parties go back and forth trying to one up each other with ridiculous shenanigans that are rarely funny and never make up for the ninety minutes of wasted time. It reminds me of dumb comedy films like Duplex—which pits neighbor against neighbor—and Are We There Yet?, in which Ice Cube goes up against his new girlfriend's mischievous kids. These sorts of films aren't typically my cup of tea, but it wasn't my turn to pick the movie, so I just sat back and watched.

And then a funny thing occurred. Almost immediately, I got drawn into the story. That wasn't supposed to happen, but it did, and I was pleasantly surprised. I normally don't even care for Danny DeVito as a director, probably due to the fact that he made the awful Duplex, which I mentioned earlier. I mean, I did enjoy Matilda, but that was a family movie that I watched as a kid. War of the Roses was something else entirely, and despite my efforts, I couldn't help but enjoying it.

It tells the story in a different way than others of its kind. Things unfold naturally and totally believably. Sure, some of the stunts that the characters pull reach the same levels of ridiculousness as in those other films that I didn't like, but here we get the impression that it's done for the sake of the story, rather than for just another cheap laugh. Instead of yawning, I was wide sitting wide-eyed on the edge of my seat. It's not just funny; it's also very real and poignant, especially considering the fact that most of us know someone who's had a really tough divorce and it's easy to see how things could go just as bad as they do in War of the Roses.

And, unlike most of these kinds of movies and apart from my expectations, we actually end up caring about the characters, despite their overabundance of flaws. They're both selfish idiots, which makes the story so much better, but they're still believable and very well acted. From moment to moment we find ourselves siding with each one. Neither of them could be called true protagonists, as they constantly antagonize each other, but there's a balance of both deserved animosity and loathsomeness between them that is very well done. They got good actors to play these roles, and they play them so well that we almost don't notice that it could have been much worse in the hands of anyone else.

The whole story is told by Danny DeVito, who plays a divorce attorney who is telling it as a warning to a prospective client who never says a word during the entire film. And the ending is great. I won't spoil it, but trust me, it's a good one. This definitely isn't the best film I've seen, but it's certainly the best of its kind, and makes me reconsider my attitude toward this type of film. I just thought the whole idea was bad, but it turns out that it's often just done very poorly.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":51509,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"1989-12-08","keywords":"marital argument,sexuality,marital problem,embarrassment,gymnastics","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The War of the Roses","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1107034393","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDlhNmQ4NTYtODk4MS00NTRjLWFjMzAtZDhhMjBkMmM4YmM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDlhNmQ4NTYtODk4MS00NTRjLWFjMzAtZDhhMjBkMmM4YmM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000140/","name":"Michael Douglas","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000678/","name":"Kathleen Turner","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000362/","name":"Danny DeVito"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000362/","name":"Danny DeVito"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035761/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023875/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0012258/","name":"Warren Adler","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0498775/","name":"Michael Leeson"],"duration":"PT1H56M"</script><metacontent="

In spite of her expertise and experience, a seasoned psychologist is completely infatuated by the sex offender she is treating in a penal institution." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8386898/","name":"Instinct","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2UzNzU2MDctZWZlNS00ZDFiLTk3OTItNjRlMDY2NGU0NTUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDU4MDI4Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In spite of her expertise and experience, a seasoned psychologist is completely infatuated by the sex offender she is treating in a penal institution.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8386898/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Judyokki"},"dateCreated":"2019-09-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Unsettlingly enjoyable","reviewBody":"Came to see the film because of the great actors and the exciting trailer. It was actually a nice and easy first half of the film. The acting is really really good. After a while I was wondering: who is more crazy, he or she? Unfortunately their issues stayed a bit on the surface, it was not clear what the origin was. However, their emotional state about it was unmistakable and the acting on point. When the film ended, I was just a bit in shock and left with a lot of questions. But I assume that was how it is meant to be. Overall, a very good movie with some distressing, somewhat creepy elements. Worth watching!!!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2163,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2019-10-03","keywords":"rape scene,sexual assault,sexual abuse,doctor patient relationship,psychiatrist","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"INSTINCT - INTERNATIONAL TRAILER","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1672789785","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjI4MWVlZjgtMmQxMC00ZjBjLWFjMzQtNmY5ZjE0ODViNzFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjI4MWVlZjgtMmQxMC00ZjBjLWFjMzQtNmY5ZjE0ODViNzFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Nicoline, an experienced psychologist, starts a new job at a penal institution. She meets Idris, a sex offender who committed a series of grave crimes. After five years of treatment, he is about to go on his first unaccompanied probation. His team of practitioners are enthusiastic about his development but newcomer Nicoline does not trust him and tries to push his probation. Idris tries his hardest to convince Nicoline of his good intentions, but slowly but surely, he transforms into the manipulative man she saw in him from the beginning. A power play emerges between the two and Nicoline, in spite of her knowledge and experience, lets herself be trapped completely."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0396924/","name":"Carice van Houten"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3092471/","name":"Marwan Kenzari"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6895565/","name":"Marie-Mae van Zuilen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0717603/","name":"Halina Reijn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0364126/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0752465/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0516893/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2937423/","name":"Esther Gerritsen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0717603/","name":"Halina Reijn"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Eastern Promises
Wschodnie obietnice
Eastern Promises
programme.desc: Eastern Promises: Directed by David Cronenberg. With Josef Altin, Mina E. Mina, Aleksandar Mikic, Sarah-Jeanne Labrosse. A teenager who dies during childbirth leaves clues in her journal that could tie her child to a rape involving a violent Russian mob family." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0765443/","name":"Eastern Promises","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTcwMzU0OTY3NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNzkwNjg2._V1_.jpg","description":"A teenager who dies during childbirth leaves clues in her journal that could tie her child to a rape involving a violent Russian mob family.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0765443/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"littlemartinarocena"},"dateCreated":"2007-12-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Viggo Mortensen Breaks New Ground","reviewBody":"A terrific, tight, violent, homo erotic thriller with a soul and a heart and if that wasn't enough, Viggo Mortensen! He is an astonishing actor, he's always been. But now his Russian "I'm just a driver" goes further than most actors would have dared. He is magnetic. Cronenberg designs two lives again for him but this time the universe where he lives is made of monsters with an accent. The splendid Armin Mueller-Stahl's bonhomie doesn't fools us for a moment. "A diary?" That's enough for us to know and to fear. Vincent Cassel is also terrific and his down, tactile moments with Viggo Mortensen, have an erotic undercurrent that is impossible to ignore. Naomi Watts brings the heart to the proceedings without ever being sentimental. David Cronenberg, I feel, is entering a spectacular new face to his already remarkable career.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":236839,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2008-04-02","keywords":"sex scene,pubic hair,nudity,ukrainian,brutality","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Eastern Promises","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2947612953","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMyNjMzMDMwMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNDQxNDYy._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMyNjMzMDMwMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNDQxNDYy._V1_.jpg","description":"Eastern Promises - Trailer #2"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0915208/","name":"Naomi Watts"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001557/","name":"Viggo Mortensen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000090/","name":"Armin Mueller-Stahl"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000343/","name":"David Cronenberg"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0110977/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0016814/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1140275/","name":"Steven Knight"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Radio Flyer
Marzyciele, czyli potęga wyobraźni
Radio Flyer
programme.desc: Radio Flyer: Directed by Richard Donner, David Mickey Evans. With Lorraine Bracco, John Heard, Adam Baldwin, Elijah Wood. A father recounts a dark period of his childhood when he and his little brother lived in the suburbs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0105211/","name":"Radio Flyer","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDc4ZjBkYzEtYzc2OS00YTUyLWI4OWItMTY3NDRlNWJhYTlhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A father recounts a dark period of his childhood when he and his little brother lived in the suburbs.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0105211/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"menaka"},"dateCreated":"2002-04-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Elijah Wood and Joseph Mazzello,such bright young talents!","reviewBody":"Sure this movie is kind of unrealistic and sometimes boring but all in all it's a very sweet movie that evokes many wonderful childhood memories.Would I have watched Radio Flyer had it not starred Elijah Wood and Joseph Mazzello?Perhaps not.Wood and Mazzello are incredible in their roles as Mike and Bobby,considering they were only 9 and 7 at the time they started filming the movie.The rest of the cast is alright,no particularly impressive performances from any of them but like I said it's Wood and Mazzello who carry the show through.There was one big surprise though,Tom Hanks.As narrator,well,let's just say after he started off at the beginning of the movie I was this close to switching the T.V off and thus missing quite a good movie. I was disappointed to find out that Radio Flyer didn't exactly hit it off at the box office,I suppose juggling such themes as child abuse and building getaway planes for a 7 year old to fly can be a difficult task. However despite its faults ,I found myself shouting insults at The King when he hit Bobby and laughing at the antics of the boys and their dog Shane.Sure you need a good imagination to enjoy it but we can cough a little of that up can't we?!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13114,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"1992-02-21","keywords":"radio flyer,physical abuse,throwing away wedding ring,stepfather stepson relationship,year 1969","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Radio Flyer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3955229465","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTE5MzQ2YTgtMzQ2ZS00MTk3LWIxNzEtN2MzZTBmYjdlNzE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTE5MzQ2YTgtMzQ2ZS00MTk3LWIxNzEtN2MzZTBmYjdlNzE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000966/","name":"Lorraine Bracco"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001334/","name":"John Heard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000284/","name":"Adam Baldwin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001149/","name":"Richard Donner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0262693/","name":"David Mickey Evans"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014288/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0116435/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0262693/","name":"David Mickey Evans"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

Limbo
programme.desc: Limbo: Directed by Ben Sharrock. With Sidse Babett Knudsen, Kenneth Collard, Amir El-Masry, Vikash Bhai. Omar is a promising young musician. Separated from his Syrian family, he is stuck on a remote Scottish island awaiting the fate of his asylum request." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9138170/","name":"Limbo","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjBiMDJkMzAtMTVhYi00NDFkLTliMTYtYTM4M2I1OGZmNDllXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM2NDM2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Omar is a promising young musician. Separated from his Syrian family, he is stuck on a remote Scottish island awaiting the fate of his asylum request.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9138170/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MiguelAReina"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great story","reviewBody":"Almost turned into Aki Kaurismaki's pupil, the Scottish director manages to create a fun, moving and profound story about the refugee drama. That sarcastic look that places a group of refugees on some remote Scottish islands where nothing happens except the ups and downs of the weather, creates a story that is humorous but slowly turns to melancholy. The same one that the protagonist has, anchored in a limbo that is physical, but above all, vital.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2522,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2021-07-30","keywords":"one word title,musician as protagonist,separation from family,musician,scottish island","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2474754073","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2Q2ODMxMDYtODMzYi00MzIzLWJiMjYtZDVmMTlhZjlhZjBjXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2Q2ODMxMDYtODMzYi00MzIzLWJiMjYtZDVmMTlhZjlhZjBjXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"Omar is a promising young musician.
